campaign.story:
5-Minute Dungeon is a co-operative, real-time card game that plays in 5 minutes! Now play with up to 6 players!
Co-operative: All players are working together against the dungeon, which makes it easy for new players to join, even if they are not hardcore gamers.
Fast Paced: There are no turns. You’re all racing against the clock to defeat the cards in the dungeon before time runs out!
Flexible: Rounds are short—only 5 minutes—and you can swap between heroes or even add or drop players between rounds.
Two new heroes have joined the party, with powerful special abilities and a new deck of cards. With them by your side, you can now play with up to six players!
Each of the bosses now gets their own custom deck of five Boss Cards, giving each dungeon its own unique personality.
And the Boss Cards introduce a new type of card to the dungeon: Curses! These cards change the game in strange new ways, and once encountered, they stick around for the rest of the dungeon.
The heroes have unearthed six powerful Artifacts with game-changing effects. These are shared by the party, and you can use them whenever you want… but only once per dungeon! And the fewer heroes you have on your team, the more artifacts you bring along, giving a helpful boost to smaller parties.
For this campaign, we've decided to focus on community involvement rather than have stretch goals. We want you to get all the goodies we designed for this expansion, no matter how the funding turns out!
So, instead, over the two weeks of the campaign we'll be revealing cards and asking you to vote on the art and titles for some Kickstarter-exclusive cards. Check back often to see what's new and make your voice heard!
5-Minute Dungeon is quick to set up and play.
The first thing you need to do is pick a hero! Like the Barbarian here...
You’ll draw a hand of cards, some of which will be resource cards and action cards. Your team will also get a number of Artifact cards, depending on how many people are playing.
Flip over the top card of the dungeon and start the timer! You now have 5 minutes to defeat every card in the dungeon, and the dungeon boss! (You can keep track using our handy-dandy timer app, too!)

Door cards come in three varieties: Monster, Obstacle, and Person. Most of the time you can defeat a Door Card by matching the symbols on the card. Sometimes, though, you'll want to use an action card, like Fireball, which can instantly defeat a Monster.
There are no turns, and anyone can play the cards needed to defeat the Dungeon Card. But be careful, any card played is gone forever, so play smart!
Sometimes your party will come across a Curse. These pesky cards affect the whole party right away and stay active for the rest of the dungeon... unless you can find a way to get rid of them, that is.
After you’ve dealt with all the door cards, it’s time to take on the big boss himself—the Baby Barbarian! Bosses take a lot more resources to defeat than any door card.

We're partnering with BackerKit to make it much easier for backers to manage their pledge choices and shipping information at the end of the campaign.
When the campaign ends, you'll receive a BackerKit survey asking you to provide your shipping information so we can get your rewards to you. As part of this survey, you'll have your choice of the following add-ons:
UPGRADE YOUR BOX: If you pledged at the Expansion or Expansion + KS Booster levels, you'll be offered a chance to upgrade your small expansion box to the larger curses box for $CDN 5. This is a perfect option if you really like the new box design, or if you like to put your cards in sleeves and you want the new tray with extra space for cards! No need to buy the game again... just upgrade your box! (Note: This upgrade is not a limited quantity item.)
ADD ON A BIG BOX: After the campaign ends, if there are any Big Box games left, each backer may add one additional Big Box to their pledge at the regular price ($50 CDN) for no additional shipping cost!
ADD ON MORE EXPANSIONS: Each backer can pledge for additional copies of the Expansion or Expansion + KS Booster editions at the regular price and at a reduced shipping rate of only $2 CDN per game! (Note: Additional expansions are not limited in quantity.)
 Rahdo Runs Through (Curses! Foiled Again!)
Gaming with Edo (Curses! Foiled Again!)
Gaming With Edo  (Base Game)
 Rahdo Runs Through (Base Game)
 Tom Vasel - Dice Tower  (Retail Edition)
 Epic Gaming Night - Curses! Foiled Again!
 Bearded Meeple - Curses! Foiled Again!
We’ve developed a custom timer app for 5-Minute Dungeon, featuring 5 different narrators who call out the minutes and encourage your team (or, sometimes, mock you). Featuring the voice talents of Jon “Epic Voice Guy” Bailey, Becky Shrimpton, and Nick “Lanipator” Landis, this app is a great companion to 5-Minute Dungeon. To celebrate the release of Curses! Foiled Again! we will be adding a new voice and new music to the timer app!
It’s available for iOS, Android, and Windows devices, and best of all, it’s completely free!
We are partnering with depots in the USA, Canada, Europe, and Australia to minimize the chances of additional duty and taxes being charged to you. Shipping to areas outside these regions may result in additional charges out of our control. Please research import regulations to learn about these potential costs for your country before placing an order.
In order to keep costs down and reduce the potential for errors, we cannot split orders to ship to multiple delivery locations. We allow a maximum of 1 delivery location per backer, regardless of reward levels or number of copies ordered. Currency Conversions
Remember that your pledge is in Canadian Dollars, and your card will be billed in Canadian Dollars when the campaign ends. Currency exchange rates change regularly. Look at your local currency exchange rate toward the end of the campaign for the most current price.
You can check out more of Alex's awesome art here:
Special Thanks
Music for the video & timer app were created by Kevin MacLeod.
Several icons in this game were made by Lorc and Delapouite. Check out game-icons.net for other amazing free icons.
Video production provided by our friends at Brick House Productions.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At Wiggles 3D Games, we’ve been making and distributing award-winning games for 15 years, so we understand quality and know how to design and produce products that we can be proud of. We also understand the type of delays that can occur in shipping and have allowed for them in our delivery estimate.

This is our second Kickstarter campaign. On our first campaign, which was for the original 5-Minute Dungeon, we demonstrated that we can deliver backer rewards to a high standard of quality and on schedule.

At http://Wiggles3D.com, you can learn more about our company and our catalog of games.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

...all bundled together in a limited-edition Curses-themed 10.5" x 10.5" box!

updates.update_userinfo: Update for Canadian Backers: Amazon Delay Resolved!
updates.update_content:
We're very happy (and relieved) to report that we've cleared up the issue with Amazon that was holding up our fulfillment. All remaining Canadian orders should be shipping out very soon!
If you are a Canadian backer who is still waiting for your game, you should receive a shipping confirmation e-mail from Amazon, hopefully in the next week or so. We'll send out another update when all shipping is completed... that way, you'll know to reach out to us if you haven't received your shipping confirmation by then.
To all of our Canadian backers: thanks once again for your support and patience while we sorted out all these shipping delays. The waiting is nearly over!

Hello backers!
It's been a little while since we last posted, so here's an update what's been going on with the Curses! Foiled Again! fulfillment.
Shipping of most backer pledges went very smoothly, considering the holiday rush our shipments got caught up in. We were able to ship out about 90% of backer pledges in December, which was our original estimated shipping date. And the other 10%? Well... unfortunately, that's mostly Canada. Sorry Canada, we've had a rough go of things in the Great White North.

Hi backers!
Just a quick update on the progress of our shipments:
Asia - Shipping now! 
The depot has been processing the orders and we expect them to go out this week. Backers should receive tracking soon! 
Australia and New Zealand - About to Ship!

Greetings backers!
We have some updates to share about the shipments traveling to our fulfillment depots.
Asia

updates.update_userinfo: Production Progress and Spooky Timer App Update
updates.update_content:
Hi Backers,
Exciting news! The factory has completed production of the games!
With production complete, we’ve booked the shipments from the factory to our five fulfillment depots and all of these should all be sailing out in the next week or so. Travel time varies by depot, of course, but we’re optimistic that we’ll be able to ship out all backer rewards in December as we promised during our campaign. Of course, there are still some factors that could cause delays out of our control, such as port congestion and customs inspections, but we will notify you by update if those should arise.

Hi Backers,
You’ll be excited to hear that we’ve approved the print proofs for the games and production is now in progress at the factory! We’ll keep you posted when we learn more about the production and shipping schedule.
In the meantime, here’s a little glimpse at the final packaging for the box covers:

updates.update_userinfo: Sneak Peek At The New Tray
updates.update_content:
Hello Backers!
One of the commitments we made to you at the start of this project was that we would redesign the game tray that comes with the larger box. Why? Well, although the original Kickstarter edition game tray did a great job of holding everything, and even had extra slots for future expansions, it didn’t have enough space to hold a full game plus expansion if you put your cards in sleeves.

Well, it’s been almost two weeks since the Kickstarter concluded, and we’ve been hard at work getting everything ready to send off to the factory for printing. As part of that process, Alex has finished the art on all of the cards you voted on, and they look great!

campaign.story:
A Flavorful Dice Game
Everyone has a green thumb when playing Herbaceous Sprouts. Unwind while enjoying this beautiful and thoughtful game of collecting seeds, using tools, and growing sprouts. Don’t relax too long though - or your friend might become the Head Gardener first!
Become the Head Gardener 
Players plant herb and flower sprouts in the community garden to score the most points. Each round, collect herb and flower seeds, acquire tools, and use them to plant sprouts in the garden.  
Gorgeous Seed Dice and Tool Card combinations create compelling choices every round.
Dice Manipulation & Classic Herbaceous Set Collection makes an expanded game experience that is still easy to learn and play.
Smooth, streamlined rounds makes a Herbaceous Sprouts a fast-moving, fun, push-your-luck game. 
  Steve Finn of Dr. Finn's Games - renowned designer of Biblios, Herbaceous, and Sunset Over Water - has created a wonderful compliment to Beth Sobel's stunning plant and garden art. Eduardo Baraf of Pencil First Games is at the helm of Herbaceous Sprouts to ensure it is the perfect balance of zippy play, compelling choices, and wonderful art in a fantastic package. 
Keith Matejka of Thunderworks Games - designer of Roll Player and the single player variants in both Herbaceous and Sunset Over Water - created the excellent single player rules for Herbaceous Sprouts. Benjamin Shulman of Jelly Bean Soup Games powers the graphic design and instructions. 
Kickstarter Green Thumb Pack!
All backers receiving the Herbaceous Sprouts game receive the Green Thumb Mini-Expansion! The expansion adds variant tool cards to Herbaceous Sprouts' beautiful play. 
Give Mom the Joy of Gaming!
Herbaceous Sprouts makes a fantastic gift and we are confident it will ship to backers prior to May 1st, 2019, in advance of Mother's Day, Sunday, May 12th. 
In the unlikely event the game's delivery is behind schedule, we'll provide you with a backer-exclusive, digital Herbaceous Sprouts Mother's Day card to let her know the game is on the way!
 Game Overview and How to Play (4:35)
Single Player Rules & Play Through

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Herbaceous Sprouts is Pencil First Games' eighth Kickstarter. Lift Off! Get Me Off This Planet!, The Siblings Trouble, GemPacked Cards, Heroes and Tricks, Herbaceous, Legendary Creatures, and Sunset Over Water all successfully funded and shipped to backers. We strive to run excellent Kickstarters and deliver fantastic products.

Herbaceous Sprouts is well-tested and balanced. The graphic design is complete and the card art is final. Box and instructions are near final and we have been working closely with our printer.

There are inherent risks whenever undertaking a project as complex and large as producing and distributing a board game, but I have been making complex projects with countless moving parts and large budgets most of my career. I've gone out of my way to surround myself with experienced board game developers, distributors, and people who have run and launched successful Kickstarters. This team of friends has been exceedingly supportive and I'm sure will help as we hit any upcoming bumps in the road. And there are bumps. Strikes, shortages, shipping delays are all hard to predict.

Most importantly, if something does go wrong, I will keep everyone in the loop as the project moves forward and comes to market. This game will exist because you all will have made it happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Loot N' Shoot is a strategic dexterity game for 2-4 players. Each player is armed with a rubber band gun and will try to eliminate the other player’s goblins while trying to grab the most loot with their own goblins. 
Don't let the rubber band guns fool you though. This game offers a lot more than just shooting goblins with rubber band guns (but we won't hold it against you if that's the main reason you back the game). Each goblin has its own special abilities that are activated when they are moved. Grab the right loot and you can use its magic abilities to hinder your foes. It will take keen shooting, tactical placement and clever use of the goblin powers to survive the hail of (rubber band) fire and make off with the most loot.
Get your copy today because we're adding some sweet loot that's only available to backers.
                                                      Additional Components (included in the box, but not shown):
4 Safety Masks 
1 1st Player Marker 
1 Rulebook
80 Rubber bands
Additional Components (included in the box, but not shown):
8 Double-sided plastic clips
1 Rulebook
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We strive to do our best to keep our backers up-to-date with all the latest news on the project. We use Kickstarter updates and social media to keep you as informed as possible as to the status of your items. However, in this business, some uncertain and ever-changing factors are beyond our control, such as holiday work schedules, customs, quality control, inspection delays, inclement weather and dock strikes and few other issues. Try as we might, we have little to no control over these issues. However, we assure you that you will be the first to know if any delays are going to happen, as we learn them.

We ship your item or items to you through various fulfillment partners located around the world. We do this to keep expenses as low as possible and we pass those savings on to you. That is why we offer great shipping rates on our projects.

Even though we work with excellent fulfillment partners, shipping issues, while uncommon, can sometimes occur. Our quality control team double-checks each product for damage before sending them out. However, there is a small chance that your items may get damaged during shipping. If your package is damaged, please contact us so we can assist you.

There are some areas we’re unable to ship to without making special arrangements. If you’re based in Brazil, Russia, (other relevant countries), please get in contact so we can work out how to get the game to you safely.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello backers, 
As of yet the production update is mostly the same as the last update. Before I go further I am going to ask the backers here to please stop using the names of the designer, graphic designer, any reviewer, or anyone else that is not Mark Sierens when discussing this project. The only person who can get this project completed is me Mark Sierens. With that being said let's go over why this game is taking so long to come to fruition.

Thank you all for your patience. 
Currently all the files have been completed and sent over to our factory to start the proofing process. Due to the nature of the expansion and the walls this has taken longer then expected. We are hoping to have the proofs back within the next 3-4 weeks. After we approve the proofs we can work on manufacturing.

Hey everyone!
We are putting the finishing touches on the files to get them to the factory for proofing. As of right now, we do not have an update on the timing of this, but we still expect this game to be out to you on time.
Thanks so much for your continued support!

Hey everyone!  

First off, we want to let you know that Screech Dragon Studios has acquired Vile Genius Games and this is why you haven't heard anything about this amazing game in a few months. All projects will be fulfilled and completed in due time. So now we're here now to give you an update on the goings on!

Hello all you excellent Shooters out there,
It’s been awhile, but after dealing with a lot of personal issues over the last few months things are back to normal. I won’t go into all the details, but let’s just say if I were to write everything that’s transpired over the last few months it would be longer than War and Peace.
However, what you want to hear about is the status of the game, so let’s go over some key points.

The pledge manager is now live for Loot N Shoot! Please check your emails to see if you have received your pledge manager link. You can confirm your pledge or upgrade and purchase addons through pledge manager. 

For those who missed out on the campaign you can preorder the game here:

 https://vilegeniusgames.pledgemanager.com/projects/loot-n-shoot-reloaded/participate/

A new addon has been added to this campaign. A preorder for Murder on the Cosmic Express. As a backer of the campaign you get a discount on Murder on the Cosmic Express.

Thank you Backers!

All 318 of you helped bring Loot N Shoot to life!. We will be doing more posts in the next couple of weeks to talk about the next steps of Loot N Shoot. We will be opening up the pledge manager for late pledges and will announce our plans to bring those stretch goals we missed to all of you. 

Thank you from the team here at Vile Genius Games. It shows all are hard work is appreciated by backers like you. 

Loot N Shoot will also be at Origins Game Fair next week at Origins in Boot 337. Come by and say hi and take a look at the game. 

Thank you for your continued support, 

The Vile Genius Games Team.

Loot N Shoot hit its first stretch goal of 5 new cards for the game to our outstanding backers!

Now is the time to really kick it into high gear and aim for some of those higher end stretch goals. We wanted to take the time to show off some of the goblins we have been working on while the campaign was going on. 

Here is the new Lootin' goblin:

campaign.story:
Through the mist, you can just about see the gigantic form of the factory. This is where the essence of dreams is shaped! We will enter the factory through the grand entrance. Here are the famous machines! You can repair, combine or dismantle them. They will produce the resources needed to repair more powerful machines. I am sure that you will quickly make the best use of your resources and the space available in your workshop to carry out the projects of the design office and gain Victory points!
The Imaginarium box.
Created by Bruno Cathala and Florian Sirieix, Imaginarium is a strategy, combination and development game with a race to objectives, for 2-5 players. Felideus Bubastis, brings fantastic animal figures together with the factory’s steampunk atmosphere in surprising and daring illustrations.
LANGUAGE: During this campaign, the Imaginarium game and the free promo packs are only available in English. In the box, only the rulebook, the machine names and the skill game aids on the back of the screens have text on them.
AVAILABILITY: Imaginarium is already on sale in some countries.The launch was a real success: in France 4000 boxes were sold during the first month.
If you live in France, Belgium, Germany, Japan, the United Kingdom, Netherlands, Denmark, Finland, Norway, Sweden and soon in Canada and China, you can find Imaginarium in stores, so there is no particular need to participate in this Kickstarter (see Why Kickstarter below).
Superb models (from 1.57 to 2.36" / 4.5 to 6.5cm high) representing the handymen on the board!
For this campaign, we have decided not to include any stretch goals. Imaginarium is already commercialized in certain countries (see Why Kickstarter) and we have improved the components and the gameplay as much as we want to: models, marbled cubes, storage box… all of these are already in the base box! But we did want to mark the occasion. In addition to the upgraded components, we are going to offer you the gift of a super promo pack which will be slipped into your game box!
The resources and the charcoalium are stored in an easily closed cardboard box that can be slipped into the game box.
 Explanation of the game in 15 minutes:
Now, follow the guide!
Before starting, make your choice of one from the five handymen of Imaginarium. Do you prefer Nicodemus, Felideus or Philomena?
To chat a little with the handymen, it’s here for Nicodemus and here for Philomena.
MIniatures sculpted by Arnaud Boudoiron
Here we see the layout of the dream factory. On this board you will place, models, machine cards, assistant cards, project tiles, and all the needed resources.
It’s over here to follow the visit of the factory.
You see this great metal staircase? It leads to the conveyor belt on which broken machines go past. Place your handyman either in front of one of them to reserve it, or in front of an extractor to earn some charcoalium.
Amazing machines move along the conveyor belt.
Five different machines and the back of the cards.
Then when it is your turn, you can:
Start up the repaired machines in your workshop;
Buy the reserved machine, if you have enough charcoalium to pay for it. It is then stored next to your personal workshop while it waits to be repaired.
Carry out 2 of the 6 actions in your personal workshop. Be careful to choose them well!
Here are three assistants and their special powers.
Three other assistant cards and the back of the cards.
At the end of the turn, you stop off at the design office to validate your projects. This is the best way of earning enough victory points to win the game. But hurry, you must be faster than the other players! The first to earn 20 victory points ends the game.
Project tiles, which are the main source of victory points.
Prepare yourself to enter the mysterious universe of the Great Machinists, the only ones to have access to the dreams that leave the factory. This, of course, is the ultimate goal of every handyman! Now, get to work!
Open the box:
PLAY

Imaginarium gets the Seal of approval from The Dice Tower:
Review with the Game Boy Geek:
The allegro Review of Game Boy Geek:
Review with Man Vs Meeple
 To see more Imaginarium videos, follow this link.
Würfel Reviews:
Imaginarium was released in spring 2018 in stores in several countries: France, Belgium, Germany, Japan, the United Kingdom, Netherlands (EN), Denmark (EN), Finland (EN), Norway (EN), Sweden (EN) and soon Canada (FR et EN) and China. There are still many countries for which we do not have distributors, the United States included. Thanks to Kickstarter we are able to make Imaginarium available to far more players worldwide, especially those who cannot find it in their usual distribution circuit. It is a way for us to promote an adventurous game that means so much to us and to give it a chance to meet the widest audience possible. By pledging to Kickstarter you will access all the goodies published for this occasion. We will do our best to make them available in the classic circuits but we cannot guarantee that this will be possible everywhere.
Bombyx has been a games publisher since 2011. Our catalogue contains more than twenty games including big hits such as Takenoko, Abyss, The Builders… We love smart games with strong graphics!
The artbook Abyss The Universe, the two expansions Kraken and Leviathan, the base game Abyss published by Bombyx and created by Bruno Cathala and Charles Chevallier.
The expansion Takenoko Chibis, the base game Takenoko (classic and giant version), published by Bombyx and Matagot. Created by Antoine Bauza.
  There will not be any Pledge Manager after this campaign. Please, select your delivery country in the pull-down list. If your country is not in the list, please contact us at support@studiobombyx.com.
We found a solution for pledgers who are not retail and who would like to pledge more than 1 box. As we will not do a Pledge manager, you have to fill in the amount when you pledge. To have more information, click here.
We will collect the information after the campaign ends, via a Kickstarter survey which is hosted by Kickstarter itself.
We will ship your rewards at our cost to our international hubs. Depending on where in the world you are, we will either ship to you from our hub in China (Asia, Pacific and Japan backers), USA (USA), Australia (Australia and New Zealand backers), and France (EU backers and the rest of the world).
Please note that the Brazilian shipping cost includes all taxation.
Game Author: Bruno Cathala & Florian Sirieix
Artwork: Felideus Bubastis
Translation: Rebecca Sevoz
Sculptor: Arnaud Boudoiron
Miniatures Painter: Martin Grandbarbe
Photographer: Jean-Baptiste Guiton

Video explanation: Ronan Loup (film maker) & Yohann Hériot (incredible actor)
Video Trailer: Fabien Delarue & Benjamin Titeux

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With Imaginarium, Bombyx launches its first Kickstarter, but as an established publishing house we do have a lot of experience in board game publishing. We also benefit from Monolith’s experience with the Conan, Mythic Battle and Batman Kickstarters, as we share the same office.

DELIVERY DATE 
Creating a game, manufacturing and shipping it are significant challenges. Production delays, shipping delays, customs delays all have to be faced. 
Bombyx will do their utmost to ensure that deliveries start according to the announced schedules. However, it is never impossible that a problem may arise. Should this happen, we will do our absolute best to provide you with accurate information and to limit any delays to a minimum.
Imaginarium is already commercially available in some countries, this means that the files for this new edition are ready and that the main manufacturing issues have already been resolved. Some of you will already have seen the retail boxes on the internet or at festivals! This means that mass production can begin rapidly after the campaign.

TERMS, CONDITIONS & REFUND POLICY
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, components, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project page.

OUR COMMITMENTS
Regarding the payments made through Kickstarter: 
• A full refund without any conditions within 14 days after the end of the Kickstarter campaign. 
• 90% refund without any conditions from the 15th day after the end of the Kickstarter campaign to the day the first ship with Imaginarium content departs from China. The start of the shipping date will be announced in a Kickstarter update.

The refunds are made by default in Euros through Kickstarter. Transaction fees may be applied by the transaction operator. If the refund through Kickstarter is not possible (for instance if the debit/credit card expired, or because of the use of a virtual card, or for any other reason), the refund will be made with a bank wire. Additional bank fees may apply depending on the bank and the country.

We commit to delivering your order in accordance with the information provided in the Kickstarter survey, or refund 90% of the paid amount if you do not fill out the following information in the Kickstarter survey by the time it is closed: 
• Indicate the detail of your order 
• Fill out your delivery information 
• Validate and confirm your order.

We regret we are unable to ship to PO Boxes, and to following countries: Cuba, Iran, Burma (Myanmar), Sudan, North Korea and Syria.

YOUR COMMITMENTS
• Follow the communications through the project updates. Kickstarter.com sends you each update by email, but if you do not receive them (spam, change in your email address…) it is up to you to stay informed. The updates are regular and all available on the Kickstarter project page. The updates will also be published on our Facebook page. (https://www.facebook.com/studiobombyx/) 
• Fill out your information to finalize your order, enter your delivery address in the Kickstarter survey before it is closed. The opening and closing dates of Kickstarter survey will be announced in a Kickstarter update. 
• Update your delivery address in the Kickstarter survey in case of change and provide valid information for your delivery (full address, email address, phone number). The deadline for updating your information and the delivery dates will be announced in a Kickstarter update. Updating your information cannot be done by mail or direct message via Facebook or Kickstarter. We will not be able to refund the orders delivered to an invalid address and the reshipment will be charged. 
• Send your refund request to the following email address: support@studiobombyx.com indicating the necessary information to process your request (email address used on Kickstarter, amount of the requested refund, and the name of the game). To ensure the efficient processing of your request and its traceability, we can not guarantee an answer through the direct messaging of our Kickstarter or facebook pages. 
• Accept the conditions and import taxes of the country you selected for your delivery. We can not refund the orders not delivered or for which the import taxes are too high in the destination country. 
• Contact in priority the support service of your delivery hub for any issue related to your order : 
- Issues related to the expedition of your parcel (absence, lost or damaged) 
- Issues related to the content of your parcel (missing or damaged references) 
- Issues related to the content of your game boxes (missing or damaged component)

The tracking information of your parcel is only valid for a few months. In case of an issue, if you do not contact the support service of your hub as indicated in the Kickstarter updates within 3 months after the end of the shipping period, we can not guarantee a positive answer to your support or refund requests.

If these terms are not acceptable to you, then we suggest that you do not participate in this crowdfunding campaign. Thank you for your understanding.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear prospective Handymen,  
Sadly, this update will be our last for this campaign. We have decided to cancel our campaign to Kickstart the English version of Imaginarium.
It would seem we were wrong in thinking Kickstarter was the right platform for the game to be made more widely available. Since the creation of Bombyx, we have worked with distributors and retailers abroad, and thanks to them, Imaginarium is already available in many countries. We are thrilled to hear from all those who are currently enjoying this game. Please know that we shall continue our search for an American distributor.

campaign.story:
Nickelodeon's Splat Attack! is a fast and frantic food fighting board game for 2 to 4 players, designed by Jonathan Ying (Star Wars Imperial Assault, Doom The Board Game). Featuring characters from SpongeBob Squarepants, Invader Zim, Hey Arnold!, and Rugrats!
In Splat Attack, players will take control of a team of 4 characters, grab a hand of food cards, and load up their team with Cool Points. Cool Points range in value from 0 to 3 points, and can be stolen from your characters when they get hit with food! However, additional Cool Points can be collected by reaching key locations on the game board.
When hit with food, splat tokens must be placed on the defending character. Placing these tokens strategically will be key to your success, as your character's grid space is limited. Once a character's grid is fill, the character is splatted and out of the game.
Players that are able to get the last hit in and splat a character, earn a golden Cool Point. Once the last golden Cool Point is taken, the game ends, and all players add up their Cool Points to determine a winner.
Each team is fighting to have the most Cool Points at the end of a Food Fight!  
Each turn, you can activate two different characters, and those characters can each perform two actions.   
A MOVE action allows a character to move a number of spaces equal to their SPEED rating.  
A GATHER Action allows a character to draw 2 food cards and pick up any Cool Point tokens they find in their space!  
A THROW action allows a character to throw food at a rival character! Some Food cards have special effects and abilities! 
You can Throw food at any opponent within your Range. Roll a number of dice equal to that food card’s Splat Rating plus your character’s Aim Rating. 
If you roll at least 1 Hit Result the throw hits the target! Your target must pull a splatter tile from the bag matching the food card’s splat rating. 
The target must place that splatter tile on their character grid. They must cover 1 space for each hit result the throwing character rolled.  
Then, take 1 Cool Point token from the target. However, if the target’s grid is completely full, or they can’t fit the tile on their grid, the target is SPLAT and you gain a SUPER Cool Point token instead!    
Once the last Super Cool point token is claimed, the game ends! The player with the most points at the end wins!  
Game play tips from game designer Jonathan Ying:
Nickeoldeon's Splat Attack is a frantic game of throwing food and scoring points, but there can be a method to the madness if you can play strategically. Given that it’s a free for all game it can often be a wise course of action to focus on not making too many enemies or being perceived as too great a threat! The last thing you want is to have other players teaming up against you.
Temporary alliances can be very useful if you can get your rivals to work with you to take down a player who seems to be running away with the game. Many characters have special abilities that allow them to assist their teammates, like how Phoebe can use her ability to protect her friends. But remember, you can also use her ability to help out a character on a different team to prevent another opponent from scoring or perhaps as leverage to discourage the player you helped from attacking you in the future!
Be wary of stacking up Danger tokens, they allow you to perform some pretty incredible feats, but they make your character a much juicier target! Also, when you take a hit from an opponent who is behind, it might be a good idea to let them take a danger token or two from your grid. That way they won't ALL go to the player who ends up splatting you!
Character and Team play tips from Jonathan Ying:
You should learn your team’s strengths and weaknesses and position accordingly. Each character has a number of unique abilities that can synergize in interesting ways. For example, Arnold’s ability to allow his allies to perform additional actions is very useful when both Helga and Gerald can do unique tricks when they Throw food.
Befitting a seasoned fry-cook, Spongebob Squarepants is a versatile character who can both move fast and draw food cards quickly for his team, Meanwhile, Sandy is a dangerous opponent in close quarters with her mastery of Kay-Rah-Tay. Use Patrick’s ability to shove rival characters closer to Sandy and use Squidward’s bad luck to your advantage by having him soak up splatter tiles and keep his allies fresh for longer.
Those Rugrats are always finding their way into crazy adventures! Tommy’s bonus action is an incredibly useful tool for giving his team an edge, he’s the only character who can reliably perform THREE attacks in a given round. To supplement his otherwise low skill ratings (I mean, to be fair, he’s one year old.) Suzie can use her ability to assist in his mobility while Angelica can steal food from nearby characters!
Zim’s team is all about hitting hard and causing chaos for their opponents. GIR is the fastest character in the game and can charge into the enemy ranks while Zim, Dib and Gaz throw a barrage of snack foods into the mix. You’ll want to get Zim into position quickly so he can perform his bonus attacks at the end of your turn, meanwhile Dib requires some careful play to tempo his unique action economy. Gaz is your trump card, she’s a solid character for your backline but after she’s taken a few hits and lost her Cool (points) she’ll go berserk and wreak havoc with incredibly high mobility, range, and accuracy!
PLEASE NOTE: All backers that have selected retailer pledges will be required to have to provide our fulfillment hub with a store address in order to recieve their pledge.  
Hey Arnold! - Character Art
Rugrats - Character Art
SpongeBob SquarePants - Character Art
Invader Zim - Character Art
 Game Designer - Jonathan Ying
Jonathan Ying is a game designer and author currently operating out of San Diego California. His design credits include Star Wars: Imperial Assault, Game of Thrones: the Trivia Game, DOOM the Board Game, and Bargain Quest!
In addition to games, his interests include comic books, tabletop RPGs and of course watching a truly alarming amount of TV animation. Honestly, he can barely remember how to perform long division but he can tell you with absolute certainty the name of Gargamel’s cat in the Smurfs animated TV show.
Game Artist - Troy Little
Three time Eisner nominee and Harvey nominee, Troy began a career in animation after graduating from the Interpretive Illustration course at Sheridan College in Ontario, Canada. In 2000 he began self-publishing his comic series Chiaroscuro which garnered him both a Xeric and PEICA grant and was eventually collected by IDW Publishing in 2007.
His second book, Angora Napkin was published in 2009 with IDW and was nominated for the prestigious Eisner Award (Best Publications for Teens) in 2010. Angora Napkin was also developed as an animated pilot for Teletoon, Canada which was broadcast Halloween night in 2010.
His comic credits also include shorts and cover work on Judge Dredd, X-Files, Uncle Grandpa, The Amazing World of Gumball, Diablo House, Animal Noir and more.
Troy lives in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island with his twin daughters Alicen, Hayden and son Nathan. He is married to comic artist Brenda Hickey.
We will be charging shipping through our pledge manager after the Kickstarter campaign has successfully completed. It is our intent to charge backers shipping that is based on the cost to ship from our fulfillment partners' hubs to you. We will ship your rewards at our cost to our fulfillment partners' hubs. From there, our partners will ship the packages out to you as quickly and efficiently as possible.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
IDW Games has successfully Kickstarted 7 campaigns and has already fulfilled 5 of those campaigns. Of our 2 outstanding campaigns, Masque of the Red Death has completed production and estimated to deliver on time, while Munchkin Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is currently in sampling for final production.

IDW Games, a division of IDW Publishing, has been publishing games into retail via standard distribution channels for over 5 years.

All of our games are manufactured in China, and as such there are a few issues that could potentially slow the delivery of our campaign. The most common issues are production delays due to plastic quality, shipping delays due to vessel schedules and weather, and customs clearance when the goods come into America.

While we have never had any of the above-mentioned delays vastly affect our delivery of a final product, there is always the potential that one of these things could cause a delay in the delivery of pledges of this campaign to backers. When these types of delays do affect campaigns, we're quick to update backers with the current situation.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Replacement Parts On The Way To Fulfillment Hubs
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone,
All the replacement components have been approved by the licensor. They boarded a boat to USA, AUS, and EU at the start of this week. The following is when we're estimating shipping will begin:
USA: 1st/2nd week of January
Asia: Next week

Hello everyone,
We've been in a holding pattern longer than expected. Unfortunately,  golden week slowed production past our original expected completion date. However, more importantly, in our rush to get these materials corrected, we operated under the impression that, since we were reproducing already printed materials, we would be ok to move forward without getting licensor approval again. That ended up not being the case.

Hey everyone,
We've unlocked addresses in the backerkit for everyone. You should now be able to change your addresses in case you need to update it for the replacement parts. If you're still at the address we shipped the original pledge to, then no action is needed. We'll keep the addresses unlocked until we're ready to ship.

Hey everyone,
Just a quick update today. Production is finishing up a bit later than expected. It will probably wrap up late next week.  At this time we're working with the factory on the best way to ship these out quickly and efficiently. 
Early next week we're going to re-open the BackerKit to let you update your addresses. We'll post an update here to let you know when that's happened.

Hi all,
First off, let's cover where things are at with the updated components:
Additional base rings: production is underway on these and we're expecting them to finish up soon. We should know their completion date by early next week.

Hello everyone,
We need to start this update with a massive apology about the lack of communication over the last month. There’s been some staff changes at IDW, and the shake up has had a more significant effect on our communication than expected. We’re extremely sorry we allowed this to happen and moving forward we have a plan in place to not let it happen again.

Hey everyone,
Sorry for the delay on this update. We expected to have a firmer bit of information this week. At this point we have the files printing at the factory and we're waiting to get an update from the factory on the delivery date. Once we have that we'll do an update with the expected delivery date.

campaign.story:
Jackhammers chattering, trucks beeping, engines roaring, the sounds of construction are everywhere. Sprawlopolis is growing and YOU are in charge of it all. The last team of planners couldn’t cut it, so the city turned to your team, the best of the best. If anyone can turn this tiny town into a thriving civic center, it’s you.  
In Sprawlopolis, 1-4 players work together to build a new city from the ground up. Using only 18 cards and a variable scoring system, the game is never the same twice.

First, players will randomly flip over 3 cards to see the scoring rules for the game.  
In this game, you will try to keep Parks away from the edges, line up lots of  Commercial blocks in a row or column, and create roads that connect your Parks.   
But not only do these 3 cards determine how you will score this game, they also determine how you win. Total up the values of all three cards, and that number is the score that you need to reach in order to win.
The example above is just one of many, many combinations (816 to be exact!). Each game has drastically different scoring rules in unique combinations, and a new score to beat, ranging from 6 to 51 points.  
Each turn, players will play one card from their hand to the growing city, trying to score as many points as possible.   
Players will have to communicate and plan without revealing their own cards in order to most efficiently develop large areas in each of the 4 zone types.   
Watch out though, road maintenance isn't cheap, so each road will cost you points in the end.   
When all cards have been placed, the game ends and players see if they have met the dynamically generated minimum score for their game.   
Can you meet the demands of the officials, work with your fellow planners and build the ultimate urban wonder? It’s time to find out!
Sprawlopolis is the next game in our ongoing Wallet Line. Simply 18 cards and rules, packed into a small wallet for maximum portability.
We sent out a handful of review copies and the reviews are glowing. Here's a selection, but there are also podcasters, instagram(ers?), and others praising the game.  
FULL REVIEW: https://thethoughtfulgamer.com/2018/05/11/sprawlopolis-review/ 
FULL REVIEW: http://www.everythingboardgames.com/2018/05/sprawlopolis-kickstarter-preview.html 
FULL REVIEW: https://whatsericplaying.com/2018/05/14/sprawlopolis/ 
FULL REVIEW: https://openseatgaming.com/2018/05/11/kickstarter-preview-sprawlopolis/ 
 FULL REVIEW: https://www.punchboardmedia.com/home/2018/5/17/the-cardboard-hoard-review-of-sprawlopolis
FULL REVIEW: https://gameosity.com/2018/05/16/sprawlopolis-kickstarter-preview/
FULL REVIEW: https://singlehandedlydotblog.wordpress.com/2018/05/14/build-a-city/
We are offering a few things. Sprawlopolis in both PNP and physical game, as well as Circle The Wagons (a competitive 2 player game by the same designers that shares a similar variable scoring method with Sprawlopolis), an Instant Collection of Button Shy games, an Instant Collection with a collector's box, a retail level for stores that want to be one of the very few that carries our wallet games, and a standard and deluxe subscription to our Board Game of the Month Club (scroll down for full details on the club).

Check out the list below and contact us with any questions. 
If you don't have Circle The Wagons, it is a MUST HAVE two player game. It's our highest rated game on Board Game Geek and our best selling game of 2017 and 2018. We're also offering Lone Cowboy, a 6 card set of solo scenarios for all of our solo friends.
Review: https://whatsericplaying.com/2018/04/02/circle-the-wagons/
 The first stretch goal is up!
Next up is Construction Zones, a 4 card expansion that adds a little wrinkle to your city planning.
If you want to add more games to your order, you can do one of three things.
Use the INSTANT COLLECTION reward levels to get 3 extra games. If you do this, please let us know which games you want using the following google form. We will make sure the games are in stock and let you know if there are any issues. Some are limited and will be first come first serve. https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc7F7LjqLvzflkvdOFAc3pLACah-0H-xq_X6vHOAy10sE6k8g/viewform?usp=sf_link
Go to our website and place an order using the coupon code 0518backer to get free shipping. Your order will ship with your Kickstarter rewards when they arrive.
If you want games now and can't wait until August, you can order at our website using the coupon code "impatient" to save 20%, and if you reach $25 (US) or $50 (INT), the shipping is free.
Our list of wallet games are below. We've highlighted some prominent games, but there is a lot more than we could even note here.
You may know the designers (Steven Aramini, Danny Devine and Paul Kluka) from their previous Button Shy game, Circle The Wagons and it's IDW reimplementation X-Files: Circle of Truth, but they have a handful of other games that you may have in your collection right now!  
We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club.
It's a subscription service where you receive unreleased microgames, promo cards, expansion content, and Kickstarter discounts.... every month. Supporters will receive from $1, $2, $5 to $10 off of EVERY WALLET GAME THAT WE MAKE. Here's a look at what we're doing right now:
And here's a peek at what's coming next month.
Our $5 June package includes the next episode of Timestamp, a time-travel game that takes place on a single postcard. Each episode is fully playable on its own, and supporters receive PNP links to previous episodes. It also includes Banned Books: Jerry, the next character in our expanding series Banned Books. All supporters receive the Banned Books base game in their first package. It's a solo game of literary characters trying to get their books un-banned. And finally it includes a copy (and a link to print more) of the next Legends of Dsyx Roll and Write Game: Seascrapers. Legends of Dsyx is an ongoing roll & write series where each game is set in the same kingdom, but the games play very differently.

Our $10 June package includes all of those and Tornado Chase, a 9-card dice-drafting game of tornado-chasing tactics. Two players jockey for position while avoiding being swept away in the storm.

And our $20 June package includes all of the above and a copy of  Sprawlopolis and all stretch goals (or the wallet game of your choice).
 Come join us at either Patreon or buttonshygames.com:
http://patreon.com/buttonshy
https://buttonshygames.com/products/board-game-of-the-month-club-basic-subscription
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Releasing games each month has established a groove with the manufacturer. We rarely see delays on their end, but we can see delays before it goes to the manufacturer. We are spending time making sure the rules are 100% right and some of you will be invited to join in on that process.

With a lot to juggle and it being two people, we will occasionally see delays. A few previous projects were a little behind schedule so we've adjusted our schedule accordingly. Our last project is only a few weeks from shipping right now, and we're on track to fulfill this month.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

A: go to the website and use the coupon code 0920us or 0920international).

Hey everyone,

Has it really been over a year since we've talked? That's so hard to imagine. In the past year so many things have happened with Sprawlopolis. Mostly international. We're seeing the game come out in a variety of languages and regions, as most recently as Brazil and China. Seeing the different versions is really cool.

updates.update_userinfo: Details on missing and incomplete packages
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update for anyone that is still missing a package, or has an issue with theirs. 
First of all, sorry it's taken so long for any of the missing packages. We were working out of our house, cars and storage units for the last few months and FINALLY moved everything into one space. We are now renting 2 rooms at a local arts center, and my only complaint is that we didn't have this setup 3 months ago. Things were really hard here, and we finally have a dining room table (it's been covered in games since August). Now we have a dedicated workspace, away from kids spilling drinks on cards (this happened a few times), and everything else that comes with working out of your house. It's really a life saver.

Hey everyone! Just wanted to give an update on fulfillment as we are nearing the end. As of today, we have less than 500 to ship. We are over 90% fulfilled and are down to some of the slower, more difficult packages with a few others mixed in.

Hey everyone, apologies if you follow more than one of our campaigns, as I’m updating all 3 of them today. But I can assure you that each has something special for that campaign.
Sprawlopolis Fulfillment 
We are still mailing tons of packages. Our goal has been 200 a day, and we’ve hit that mark on most days. Some have been tough with back to school night for both Carolyn (fulfillment) and our kids, and last weekend's Keystone Comic Con (please don't let me do comic cons ever again). But we're still pushing through, and don't see any complications in the next week to slow us down. In fact, Carolyn is off tomorrow and we're going to try to hit 400 (which is 8 mailing bins).

campaign.story:
In Cosmic Run: Regeneration, you lead a fleet of ships on a quest for the discovery of new worlds.  But watch out!  This region of space is populated with dangerous meteors that frequently hit the planets.  So you are not only racing your opponents, but also the meteors.
Cosmic Run: Regeneration is a turn based game for 1-4 players.  You begin a turn by rolling 6 dice. After the roll, you must assign at least 1 die to planets (to move ships), alien cards (to recruit the aliens), or to your tech card (to gain crystals).  After assigning, you may re-roll any unassigned dice. All of the locations have different assignment requirements, so you must choose which kind of strategy to employ: Do you push your luck to try to move up more valuable planet tracks or play conservatively by placing dice on less valuable tracks? Do you recruit aliens who will help you score points and grant special powers? When should you spend your crystals? It is a game that is not only easy to understand, but contains many interesting decisions.
A strong selling point is that the game can be played competitively, cooperatively, or solo.  Each of the variants have been fully developed and all offer a compelling gaming experience.
Cosmic Run: Regeneration was co-designed by Steve Finn and his two sons, Seamus and Orion. Seamus contributed greatly to the original version (published a couple years ago) and Orion helped with the development of the newly revised co-op game.  Seamus and Orion also play tested and made adjustments based on the play test sessions.
All backers receiving a copy of Cosmic Run: Regeneration through this campaign will receive the Allies Expansion at no additional cost inside their copy of the game. This expansion pack includes 6 ally cards (plus 2 instruction cards) that add an interesting twist by giving players special powers.  Each ally card has an icon with a die, numbered from 1 to 6. At the end of a player's turn, the player recruits the ally whose number matches the yellow die.  The player may then use the ally on future turns until another player recruits the ally.
Cosmic Run: Regeneration is a highly revised version of a previously Kickstarted game, Cosmic Run. Here's a quick description of the major differences between Cosmic Run: Regeneration (CR:R) and the original Cosmic Run (CR).
CR:R has a tri-fold board showing 6 planet tracks. CR had 5 individual planet track boards. The 6th planet track has a new mechanism for movement based upon the number of pips on a newly added yellow die. 
CR:R uses "meteor cards" to determine meteor strikes, as opposed to a dice roll. This cuts down on the randomness of meteor strikes and ensures a timely game end. 
CR:R includes a new alien race, the Dahas. They allow a player to take a turn with an extra die. 
In CR:R all alien cards are 1x use. Players no longer need to rotate cards. Also, alien cards are "retired" during the game to score points, instead of scoring at game end. Sets of cards score fewer points as they are turned in, so there is a race to retire aliens early, adding more excitement and decision-making to scoring points with aliens. 
The Monashians now all have the same power, i.e., the power of a virtual die. This streamlines the card powers, making it easier to play. 
In CR:R, Infodere tokens replace the crystal tokens. Some of these are placed on the board and players can acquire them as they move up tracks, making for more interesting movement decisions. Infodere tokens are also gained by Infodere aliens (similar to CR's crystal tokens for Infoderes). 
Much of the graphic design elements are updated. 
The tech card now just collects crystals, so players do not need to move a marker on the tech card. 
The cooperative game has been seriously improved with the use of tool cards and many new rules. 
The solo game has also been improved with new rules. 
CR:R will be a bigger game in a larger box too. 
There are some other minor rule changes as well. Watch this video if interested. 
Note that the cover artwork has changed since these videos were made. Also, the videos may reference another game, Waters of Nereus, which was originally planned to be Kickstarted at the same time as this game, but that game will be Kickstarted in the late fall of 2018.
The following is not a review, but a play through by the Painted Meeple.
 VIDEO OF COOPERATIVE GAME
The following is not a review, but a video of a co-op version of the game played by the designers.
Shipping Information
Dr. Finn's Games offers "flat rate" shipping, so you pay one price for shipping regardless of the number of games. The rate is based on location.
Customs Information 
U.S./Canadian/U.K. Backers: The games will be shipped to you from your respective country, so no duties will be required.
E.U. backers:  The games are shipped from the U.K.  As of now, this means you would not pay any duties either.  However, due to Brexit negotiations, it is possible this might change before the time of shipping (though perhaps not?).  
All others: The games will ship from the U.S. and you may be responsible for paying import duties and other taxes.
• Get a fun game by a highly regarded game designer. All of Dr. Finn's games receive glowing reviews from members of the board gaming community.
• Receive the Allies expansion at no additional charge. The Allies expansion pack is included inside the copies of the game received by backers of this campaign.
• Help bring this game to existence. If this campaign does not fund, the game very likely will not be made.
• No post-Kickstarter bargain prices. You will not find Dr. Finn's games on sale at online retailers a week (or even months) after a Kickstarter campaign because I do not sell my games to them. I do have my own sales, but I usually wait until the game has been published for a while to do so.
• Great add on prices. This campaign provides an opportunity to get multiple Dr. Finn's games at a great bundle price. Check out the various levels to see the great deals. You can also add games to customize your rewards.
• Support an independent game designer. Dr. Finn's Games is not a big company and will only continue with successful crowdfunding campaigns.
Find out more about the combo games by following these links:
C.O.G.            Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire         Foragers   
Little Flower Shop         Sunset Over Water
This campaign offers a great opportunity to pick up other great games from Dr. Finn's Games for 1 flat rate shipping price. If you're interested, there are two ways to do so.
DURING THE CAMPAIGN: Decide which games you would like to add, calculate the amount and add it to your pledge. After the campaign, you will use a survey to inform Dr. Finn's Games of your add-on choices.
AFTER THE CAMPAIGN: you can wait until the campaign is over, then decide to add additional items at that time.
LIMITED QUANTITIES WARNING: It is possible, though unlikely, that some of the add on games are oversold during the campaign and backers may not receive some of the add on games requested. In this case, backers would receive a full refund on any add on items not received. Although this is very unlikely, it is a possibility.
*Note: There is a 4-player and a 5-player version of the Little Flower Shop.
PROMO PACKS AVAILABLE AFTER THE CAMPAIGN
Through the pledge manager, after the campaign, backers will be able to order special promotional packs for some of Dr. Finn's older games, such as those for Capo dei Capi and Institute for Magical Arts. Sorry, but promo packs are not available for Herbaceous or Sunset Over Water (as those are no published by Dr. Finn's Games).
SPECIAL OFFERS AFTER THE CAMPAIGN
During this campaign, Dr. Finn will be doing an inventory count of his older games, which are not listed above. Such games may be offered as a late add-on at discounted prices.  Also, such games as Herbaceous, Sunset Over Water, and Biblios may also be offered.
Dr. Finn's Games publishes the games of Steve Finn, an independent game designer. Dr. Finn's Games relies heavily on funds raised during Kickstarter campaigns and direct sales to individuals. Thus, your support in this campaign is greatly appreciated.
Reviews of Dr. Finn’s Games have been overwhelmingly positive. In one of his many reviews of a Dr. Finn's game, Richard Ham (”Rahdo Runs Through”) dubbed Dr. Finn the “King of the Filler.” In addition to Cosmic Run: Regeneration, other games from Dr. Finn's are available to backers of this project. Many of these games are low in stock, with reprints very unlikely for a long time, if at all. So, if you're interested in other Dr. Finn's Games, now is a great time to pick them up.
Boardgamegeek.com is a great place to do research on Dr. Finn's Games. Click on the name to go to the BGG page: Biblios, Biblios Dice, Butterfly Garden, Capo dei Capi, Cosmic Run, Cosmic Run: Rapid Fire, Foragers, Herbaceous, The Institute for Magical Arts, Let Them Eat Shrimp, The Little Flower Shop, Slush Fund 2, Sunset Over Water.
Most of the artwork of Cosmic Run: Regeneration comes from the original Cosmic Run, which was illustrated by Lawrence van der Merwe. Lawrence provided two new illustrations for this game: the artwork for the cover and the Daha alien card.
Sebastian Koziner is a graphic designer who has worked with Dr. Finn's Games on many projects and he's done a great job updating the graphic design of this game and using the old artwork to create the game board. His wife, Rocio Ogñenovich, made the main campaign video. Together, they operate OK Art Studio.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Please read carefully before backing this project.

DELIVERY AND PAX UNPLUGGED
The game is likely to be manufactured by November and delivered in December. However, it is possible that Dr Finn receives the games in October or early November, which would mean this would be in time for PAX Unplugged. In all previous campaigns, Dr Finn has ensured that backers are the first people to receive the games. However, in this particular case, Dr Finn may wish to show and sell the game at PAX Unplugged, which is usually the only major convention Dr Finn's Games has a booth at. Ideally, the game could be manufactured, shipped and delivered to all backers before this (though this is unlikely). It's also unlikely to have the game for PAX Unplugged. But, if Dr Finn does have it in time, he hopes backers will understand the need for his small business to take advantage of the convention's size to help publicize this game. Also, backers will be allowed to pick up games at PAX Unplugged (if available). This is all speculation and, if too many backers think this is wrong, Dr Finn will not sell the game at PAX.

PRODUCTION RISKS 
Game manufacturing and publishing contains a number of risks. For this project, the greatest risks follow from the fact that the packs will be manufactured in China and shipped to the U.S. The most serious threat in this regard concerns quality control over the manufacturing. A more likely threat, though less serious, is the possible delays involved. Dr. Finn's can mitigate both of these concerns. First, I will be using a manufacturer who has produced good results on card projects in the past. Second, I have successfully completed almost all of my Kickstarter campaigns right on time or even early (only 1 project was a few weeks late). If any delays do unexpectedly occur, backers will be notified promptly.

MISSING/DAMAGED ITEMS 
If you receive any rewards that are missing items, please contact me at doctorfinns@gmail.com and replacements will be promptly shipped. If the item arrives damaged, you'll receive replacements for whatever is damaged. Please send along a picture, as I may be able to get reimbursed from the shipper. For the past few projects (after switching manufacturers and shipping companies), we've had a very low defect rate (less than 1%).

REFUNDS 
Refunds are not usually given, unless there is a failure to deliver the games you've requested. However, if you are completely unsatisfied with any game, please contact me and we can discuss it.

LOW QUANTITY ALERT 
Some Dr. Finn's games are getting low in stock and it is not feasible to track add-on items during the campaign. It is possible (but unlikely) that there is not enough of a particular game to fulfill all rewards. If this happens, you will be refunded all expenses related to adding that item on.

DELIVERY DATE 
Unlike many Kickstarter campaigns, Dr. Finn's Games has a great track record of being on time. Of course, unexpected things happen and there is chance that the game will not be shipped on time. I will keep you updated if the unexpected happens.

UNDELIVERED ITEMS 
If you provide an incorrect address or fail to update your address and a shipment is returned, it is your responsibility to pay for the re-shipment.

SHIPPING 
Please read the shipping section above.

UPDATES 
After this campaign you may receive updates on Dr. Finn's Games' other projects. However, such updates will be infrequent.

By backing this project, you acknowledge and accept the risks and challenges just stated.

Thanks! Dr. Finn's Games
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Two years ago, Action Phase Games released the zen card game Kodama: The Tree Spirits. This year we are excited to expand the Kodama universe with Kodama Duo - a two-player version that utilizes the core mechanics of Kodama - the Decree Phase, a Growing Phase, and a Kodama Phase.  Kodama Duo also expands Kodama to six players, and introduces new draft rules for Kodama.
Kodama Duo is a two-player version of Kodama: The Tree Spirits. You will grow a tree by placing branch cards in clever arrangements, making a happy home for your Kodama! 
Kodama Duo is a card placement game for 2 players that plays in 30 minutes. Players will turn over one Decree card per season to set the unique conditions. During the Growing Phase, players take turns revealing branch cards and splitting them into two piles until each player has added four branch cards to their tree. In the Kodama phase, players will each choose one of their Kodama to score and live in their tree. The game lasts 3 seasons (12 turns) and whoever cares for their Kodama best will be remembered for generations! 
If you aren’t familiar with Kodama: The Tree Spirits, you can check out the BGG page for more details. Also, follow along on our Kodama Duo BGG page and click the heart to like the game!
For more information, we encourage you to view the videos directly below, or simply read our draft rulebook here.
There are a couple of cool twists on the original Kodama rules for Duo.
First, instead of a display of branch cards to choose, each turn one player (the splitter) will reveal three branch cards from the deck. They will then split those cards into two piles. The other player (the chooser) will select one of the branch piles. The other pile will go to the splitter. Then, both players will add one of the branch cards they received to their tree. The player who received two branch cards will discard the extra card.
Second, Duo introduces spirit tokens, which are tokens with the six features from Kodama. After the player that received two branch cards discards one, the other player receives a spirit token from the discarded branch card. They pick one of the features from that card and take the corresponding spirit token. That player then places that token over one of the icons on their tree. This allows interesting scoring interactions as feature chains can be shortened or lengthened to increase the scoring potential for future branch placements.
Additionally, most of the new Kodama cards and Decree cards interact with the spirit tokens and splitter/chooser mechanic. All of these changes provide an interesting twist on the core mechanics you already love about Kodama.
Duo also introduces the ability to play Kodama: the Tree Spirits with six players. With this update, we've included new rules for branch selection. Each player will secretly choose from four branch cards simultaneously in a draft format. Players will also be allowed to place and score their branch cards simultaneously. This will shorten the downtime that could have been added by including more players.
Here Rahdo reviews Kodama Duo:
If you aren't familiar with Kodama - Have Rodney from Watch It Played show you how to play!
We know that some backers want more than one copy of a reward level. To do this, you will need to 1) pledge at the highest level from which you want the rewards, and 2) add to your pledge amount based on the add-on chart (ie, you don’t have to add shipping cost for each item, just the first which Kickstarter does automatically). For full details on how to add-on items to your pledge, check out the chart located below. 
We are going to use a pledge manager for this project. That means you can add to your pledge amount after the project is completed, however we highly recommend that you pledge for everything that you want to receive through Kickstarter. In order to get games to you as quickly as possible, the window for the pledge manager will be very short. 
To change your pledge amount during the campaign, click the “Manage your Pledge” button on the top of this page.
Then, click “Change your Pledge” enter the new pledge amount and click “Continue.” The tricky part is that you’ll need to calculate the total pledge amount on your own and won’t get an immediate confirmation of what you have added. This has to be done before the project ends (10pm pacific, Thursday, May 31st). We will get all the details we need from you when we send the project surveys out (we need to get the information quickly in order to send the right number of games and add-ons to their fulfillment centers). 
Kodama Duo is the 43rd project from the combined teams behind Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games. With the successful execution of our first 42 projects, we have become experienced publishers with a reputation for great games that are delivered in a timely fashion. 
Kodama Duo was designed by the talented Daniel Solis, the same designer of Kodama: The Tree Spirits. 
This game has been blind tested, in addition to being tested in-house, ensuring that every part of the game is of the best possible quality. We are confident that this game will be in your collection for years to come. 
All of the art assets are complete and ready for immediate upload after the project funds. Prices include US shipping. 
This project is also EU & Canadian friendly.
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. Every month, tens of thousands of people pledge millions of dollars to creative projects in dozens of categories. 
A person who supports a project is called a "backer." The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge." 
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards," depending on the amount you pledge. For example, if you pledge $19 to help back the project, we'll offer you a copy of the game along with any stretch goals we achieve as soon as it is manufactured. 
You can become a backer in just three easy steps: 
Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page. 
Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. 
Step 3: Enter your pledge amount, and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds! That's it! It's really that simple! Thank you for backing! 
Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter, and share with your friends and family. Also, be sure to like Indie Boards and Cards on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for real-time updates about this project and more! 
INNER SPIRIT: (Pledge $19 or more) One copy of Kodama Duo with all of the stretch goals. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates in the Extra Copies section. 
SHAPESHIFTERS: (Pledge $34 or more) One copy of Kodama Duo with all of the stretch goals and one copy of Kodama: The Tree Spirits. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates in the Extra Copies section.
RAY OF LIGHT: (Pledge $34 or more) One copy of Kodama Duo with all of the stretch goals and one copy of Kokoro. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates in the Extra Copies section.
KINDRED SPIRITS: (Pledge $47 or more) One copy of Kodama Duo with all of the stretch goals, one copy of Kodama: The Tree Spirits, and one copy of Kokoro. Shipping included in the US. Other shipping pledge rates based on location. For additional copies in the US and international, check our rates in the Extra Copies section. 
Our plan is to have a limited number of Kodama Duo available at Essen with all the stretch goals from this project. We will not be taking reservations as in years past, everything will be first come, first served at Essen. If you would like to get the rewards from this project, we suggest you back through kickstarter!
While our current production schedule looks like Kickstarter rewards will ship out well before Essen, it may be the case that we have games at Essen before the Kickstarter backer copies are sent. It may also be the case that we are unable to get games to Essen in time. I wish we were able to absolutely guarantee results, but we simply know that we can't make such commitments when so many other parties are involved in the process.
If you still want to try Essen pickup – DO NOT PLEDGE FOR THIS PROJECT
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the 43rd Kickstarter project from the combined teams behind Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games. We have learned how to streamline the game publishing process and have successfully delivered all of our previous Kickstarter projects to thousands of supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Kodama:Duo will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

Indie Boards and Cards currently has two previous kickstarter projects from earlier this year that have already funded that have not sent out rewards. Those projects are scheduled to be delivered in October of 2018. We have had multiple projects ongoing in each of the past five years, so are confident that this will not cause delays to those projects or this one.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY 
We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card. 
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS 
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: The Kodama Series Grows Beyond A Single Tree!
updates.update_content: We've expanded the Kodama universe again! Work together to grow the forest for your Kodama & their forest friends with Kodama Forest...

When they grow older, every Kodama is given a tree of their own, and it's their job to watch over it and help it grow healthy and strong. From trunk to twig, they must keep it green and growing, the perfect home for flowers, mushrooms, and critters of all kinds. Even other kodama love to travel around and visit new trees. Now it's your turn! Create your own masterpiece of branches and leaves, and make the forest even more beautiful!

To receive replacement parts and/or games or for any other issue, please complete all of the following steps:
