Hey!
In the last update, I mentioned that two new expansions for Village Pillage were coming to Kickstarter. Well, I'm excited to announce that the Kickstarter will be launching this coming Tuesday, the 1st of October!

updates.update_userinfo: Seeking playtesters for Village Pillage: On the Rogue Again!
updates.update_content:
Hey!
Tom and I have been hard at work on putting together the new Village Pillage expansion, and we're at the point where we need YOUR help in making sure all the cards are balanced, fun, interesting, and, uh, don't break the game!
If you'd like to help us playtest Village Pillage: On the Rogue Again, send me an email at peter@beard.blue with "" in the subject! We'll likely do several waves, so don't panic if you don't hear back from us straight away. To help out, all you need to do is run a few games with the cards, and as a special thanks, you'll get a free copy when the Kickstarter is released!

Hey!
By now, everyone should have received their copies of Village Pillage, and hopefully played a few dozen times. If you were feeling particularly enthused about it, you might even have rated the game on BoardGameGeek or made a post about it on social media! ;)
If you haven't gotten your copy, please email support@jellybean.games and we'll get it resolved as quickly as possible.

Hey!
If you're a board game fanatic (or "geek", if you will) you're probably aware of Boardgamegeek.com - it's a site used by all of us "boardies" (as board game fanatics are referred to by literally no one) to learn more about games we love, and even discover new games to play.
It's that last part that I want to talk about today - we here at Jellybean Games believe that is the best game we've put out so far. It's pretty (thanks, Tania!), it's easy to learn and a lot of fun (thanks, Tom and me!) and the wooden turnips are very fun to touch with your hands and mouth*.

project_data.project_name: Village Pillage - a 30-minute game of risk and betrayal!

campaign.story:
You are a pastry chef in charge of putting delicious ﬁllings in a variety of cakes, pastries, and baked goods. By coming to work early and making use of your full pantry of supplies, you will earn money, customer reviews, and critical acclaim. With a little luck, you might win out over your rivals and be crowned Star Baker!  
Filler combines many of the ingredients that have made Green Couch Games a treat to bring to the table. Easy-to-learn rules mixed with a quick playtime and playful appearance makes Filler a great game for families of casual gamers or connoisseurs looking to pass the time waiting for more guests to arrive. In the game, players will use multi-use cards and a blend of simultaneous action selection, time and resource management, set-collection, and hand-building to collect ingredients needed to fill tasty pastries on their way to becoming the Star Baker. 
Starting with a hand of 3 cards with various start times and basic ingredients, players will choose a card to reveal along with other players to determine the turn order. The earliest player to show up for work goes first and so on around the table. Using cards from their hands (Pantry), players may use ingredients they have acquired to Fill recipes from a central row of available cards (Recipe Book) or Restock The Pantry by picking up all of their previously played cards. Each recipe filled will provide new start times and ingredients to use in future rounds and may earn points that are represented by money, customer reviews, or critical acclaim at the end of the game. The availability of bonus points and cards containing special actions help to direct players’ choices in the kitchen, add depth of play, and provide variety and replayability.  
This card game crams a lot of sweet delight into its small package. With illustration and graphic design by Claire Donaldson (Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun, Go Nuts For Donuts, Food Truck Champion), Filler will leave players with a mouth-watering desire to play this delicious game again and again.  
Filler is a game for 1 to 5 players, ages 8 and up and is designed by Jonathan Chaffer of GRUBS (Grand Rapids Unpublished Boardgame Society). This game follows Chaffer’s first game, Stroop, from Grand Gamers Guild. The game plays in 20-30 minutes.
Here's a quick video from designer, Jonathan Chaffer, teaching how to play Filler:
Filler consists of a deck of 70 cards and a rulebook in a small box that's great for grabbing on-the-go!
Here's what folks are saying about this yummy little game!
GeekyGaymerGuy says:
                   "Filler has been an absolute blast to play. We’ve really been impressed with how this card game had been balanced. Just because you have the ingredients to fill a pastry doesn’t mean that you should. The game honestly feels a little like a deck building game as you acquire new cards and cycle through your discard pile to refill your pantry. " -One Board Family
"Is Filler empty calories? Well, yeah, sort of. But like any good treat, it’s not too filling, and it makes up for any lack of depth with smooth, intuitive mechanics and quick, fun gameplay. This one’s a no-brainer; Filler is the sort of game you will throw in your backpack or purse or briefcase and play anywhere with basically anyone. Everyone’s collection’s got room for some Filler."-Gameosity
"I think Filler delivers exactly what it promises: a nice, short game that may not be a showstopper centerpiece but works perfectly well as a crowd-pleasing snack. If you enjoy casual games (and pastries), Filler just might hit the spot."-Jonathan Liu, GeekDad
Tantrum House says:
                                                                       "Get the very best donut!" -Draft Mechanic Podcast
"Overall, Filler is a fun little game. It’s designed for a specific niche and I think it hits the mark well though; it’s light and reasonably easy to pick up...I think this occupies the “light game” space a bit more, rubbing elbows with games like Medici: The Card Game, The Fox in the Forest, or Harvest Dice." -What's Eric Playing?
Brian's Got Game says:
Listen to Jason and Jonathan chat about Filler here!
"If you’re looking for a game that's quick, simple and fun, then Filler may be your family’s next filler game. If you have a casual gaming crowd that needs an introduction to set collection, then Filler is probably your group's next filler game." -Jumbalaya Plays Games
Bearded Meeple says:
                                       "In short, Filler is a neat little game that uses multi-use cards in a interesting and unique way." -Open Seat Gaming
Deluxe 15" by 10" cloth playmat with rubber backing!
We have plans to add value (STRETCH GOALS!) to Filler that we think you will really appreciate. We'll achieve this by upgrading components and increasing replayability with added game content.  
We have several stretch goals in mind and we hope to hit them all! But know that just as with our previous campaigns, we won't likely be adding more just to add more. We believe that more isn't always better, especially if it holds up production and delays delivery.  
That being said, we'll be listening closely to your feedback and ideas and will carefully consider all the ideas that comes our way.  
Here's a preview of what's to come with YOUR help:
Shipping fees will be added to your pledge level when you select your home location.  
UK and EU copies will be shipping from within the UK with VAT paid!
Note: International Backers outside of the UK and EU will be responsible for any import fees, brokerage or delivery surcharges, or applicable taxes that may be levied after we have shipped your package.  
We have learned that shipping is a costly endeavor, especially with the ever-changing rates of the US Postal Service. We must try to keep our costs as low as possible to keep our games at an appropriate price point for when they hit retail.  
We understand that shipping to our international friends can be cost prohibitive and that others have found creative ways to mitigate some of this cost. As a small company that handles our own fulfillment, we simply pass our shipping cost on to our backers. In addition, it is our goal to continue to develop our network of awesome international partners that we have worked with to localize Filler for game markets around the world. 
If you've checked out the videos and read the reviews and still want more info, you can check out the First Edition Rules PDF RIGHT HERE! 
Read the SOLO Rules RIGHT HERE!
The rules are currently being edited and reformatted for clarity and to match the updated graphic design.  
The rules are hosted on BoardGameGeek and will require a free account to download. But if you like games, BGG is the place to be so head over there now to get plugged into the world-wide gaming community!
If you've read the rules and are still on the fence please check out the free Print & Play version of Filler! This way, you can try the game out and if you like the experience then come on back to pledge for a full production copy!  
We believe in this game and know that if you give it a chance you'll see the love and attention we've put into developing it for game tables around the world. So get on board and give it a go! See for yourself if Filler is for you. 
 Get the files here! 
Jonathan Chaffer is previously the designer of Stroop from Grand Gamers Guild. He is a charter member of the Grand Rapids Unpublished Boardgame Society, a collective of designers, publishers, and playtesters who meet regularly to hone each others’ skills.  
In his professional life, Jonathan is a principal of Rapid Development Group, a consulting firm specializing in web and mobile applications, and is the author of several books on the jQuery JavaScript library. He lives in Grand Rapids, Michigan with his wife, Jennifer.
Claire Donaldson is an illustrator and designer working out of Seattle. She’s known for sketching furiously and has a knack for imbuing inanimate objects with an unsettling degree of cuteness. If you would like to see more of her work, you can find her portfolio at clairedoesntlaugh.com. 
Her credits include work with Daily Magic Games, Gamewright Games, and the previous Green Couch Games title, Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun.
Green Couch Games was founded by Jason Kotarski to release great little games that make great big connections. Filler will be their eleventh release following Fidelitas, Best Treehouse Ever, JurassAttack!, Avalanche at Yeti Mountain, Wok on Fire, Rocky Road a la Mode, OutLawed!, Ladder 29, Before The Earth Explodes, and Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun. You can check out our other games right here on our website!  
Jason is also a game designer and co-host of 20 Minutes of Filler and runs the 20 Minutes of Filler Facebook Group that seeks to create a larger platform for the best games that come in small packages.
Use these tasty avatars to add some flavor to your social media profiles!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
My experience with our previous campaigns, Fidelitas, Best Treehouse Ever, JurassAttack!, Avalanche at Yeti Mountain, Wok on Fire, Rocky Road a la Mode, OutLawed!, Ladder 29 and Before The Earth Explodes has provided a solid foundation for me to build on. And so far I have been able to avoid delays and common pitfalls by paying special attention to the following areas and building on previous experience:

Art and Design. The art and design for the game is nearly complete so we'll be ready to print shortly after the close of the campaign. I always like to show you I mean business by paying for the art and design upfront!

Playtesting and Reviewing. Filler has been tested by many different playtesters and even a bunch of game designers. I have sent a bunch of prototypes to a variety of reviewers. I want to earn your trust by providing you with a solid product that has been thoroughly tested and reviewed by folks from varying backgrounds and perspectives.

Past Experience. This is the eleventh Kickstarter project I've run for Green Couch Games and I have helped with several other successful campaigns. Also, having spent many years working in retail and customer service, I understand the importance of treating backers with respect and following through with projects.

Of course, there are always unexpected circumstances that pop up, but I PROMISE to communicate every step of the way and do my best to use creative problem solving meet the challenges head on.

Thank you so much for giving Green Couch Games a chance. As a small company, I truly can't do this without you. I will do my best to thank you by creating great little games that you love to play.

Sincerely, 
Jason Kotarski, founder of Green Couch Games
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Bakers!
We received an update from our UK Fulfillment partner that is handling the shipping for copies outside of the US and Canada! Our stock has arrived and been checked into the system and I've placed the orders to ship those copies out! It's just a matter of time before they are picked and packed and the last of the copies of Filler are shipped to backers.

Hello Bakers!
I just returned from vacation and wanted to swing by to give you an update on shipping. As of Friday, March 29 (before I left for vacation) all copies of Filler had shipped to US and Canadian backers! Hopefully, most of you have received your games and having fun making tasty treats with your families and friends!

updates.update_userinfo: So close I can taste it!
updates.update_content:
Hello Bakers,
We're nearing the finish line! 
At the end of last week I received word that Filler has arrived in the US warehouse of the company that handles our sales on the distribution side of things. I attempted to schedule a time to make the 3 hour drive down to pick up the Kickstarter copies but they asked me to wait until next week because they are in the midst of a heavy new release week and needed the time to clear out some space before officially bringing in our stock. Next week they are actually moving the entire warehouse  to a new location (funny enough, the new location is only 30 minutes from where I live) so we were trying to figure out the best time to come between getting their new releases out the door and packing everything else to move! So the plan is that I will go down to get the games on Tuesday so that way we don't lose more time in the shuffle of all of there warehouse stock being packed and moved and processed.

As you've seen, the ship has finally docked in the US, and I'm excited! We are awaiting customs clearance now, which never has a set schedule. Once that's done, the boxes need to make their way across the country to the warehouse, where the games will be packaged and shipped to your door.

Hello Bakers!
Just wanted to swing by and let you know that I checked in at the factory to make sure that the boat left port as scheduled last week. They have informed me that the pastries have left the building and are on their way.
The vessel our games are traveling on is called the Greenwich Bridge and as of a day ago it was just off the coast of Japan.

Happy New Year Pastry Fans!
I just wanted to come by and give you update about the shipping for Filler!
I heard from the factory this morning that production is finished, assembly has taken place, and the games have been packaged for shipping. The vessel that the games are being loaded onto is schedule to leave port for the United States on January 18th.

Hello Bakers!
Yesterday was a good mail day! The hard copy samples of Filler have arrived! They are looking great but you can see for yourself below!

Hello!  
I want to apologize the for my lack of communication recently. The last couple of months have been a stressful time for me as I've had to attend to personal/family issues, finish shipping Best Treehouse Ever: Forest of Fun, and do some travelling.
I did want to let you all know that I heard from the printer and they are sending me the hard copy sample of the game this week! This is great news that has been a long time coming. As soon as I have that in hand I'll be back to share another update and be sure to show off what I get with some pictures or video.

Hello Star Bakers!
I wanted to pop by and give you an update about the production process of Filler. As tomorrow is the last day of October, I'm disappointed to have to report that we won't make that estimated date for delivery. I apologize for that. Using my experience and knowledge from the last 10 campaigns I've delivered, I chose what I thought was a reasonable date for delivery and unfortunately I under-estimated the time that printing this simple card game would take.

updates.update_userinfo: Waiting for proofs, GrandCon, and Into the Black Forest on Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Hello Bakers!
I just wanted to drop you a note to let you know that we are still awaiting proofs for Filler. We got a couple items back from the printer that need adjustments before they could get things rolling and we got them back right away so things should continue to move forward smoothly.
There are a couple other items of note that I wanted to share with you as well. This weekend Jonathan and I will be hanging out at our hometown conventions, We also just launched a new game from Michigan designer, Jason Slingerland called ! Here's some more info:

campaign.story:
Designed by Andrew Nerger and Jeffrey Chin (Road To Infamy, Cosmocracy), Crypt is a light set collection game with a unique dice placement mechanic for 1 to 4 players with easy-to-learn rules and exciting strategic gameplay, all in 20 minutes. Check out the rulebook to learn more.
Plus, its compact size makes it easy to put in your pocket and take it anywhere! 
In Crypt, you send your servants into the crypt chambers to pilfer the best treasure. While your servants will unquestioningly do your bidding, grave robbing is exhausting work!
Claim Treasure cards by placing Servant dice and choosing any value on each die to designate each Servant’s effort. The higher the value, the more likely your Servant will become exhausted when you roll the dice. 
You can also push out your siblings’ Servants by placing dice with values exceeding the occupying Servants’ total effort.
After everyone has placed their dice, everyone rolls. If you roll less than the effort, you lose the die.
If you collect a set of treasure, you can pawn them to a Collector who will give you bonus points or a special ability. The Collector cards have A and B sides, so you can play with different combinations of bonuses.
At the end of the game, players will add the value of their treasure plus any bonus points from selling sets to Collectors. The player with the most valuable collection wins!

Risks and challenges
This is R2i Games' 4th game on Kickstarter! We've learned much from our previous campaigns and implemented many improvements for Crypt.

Quality of Product: Crypt has been thoroughly tested at conventions and gaming events. Rules and card text have been meticulously proofread, and the artwork is complete. Once the campaign finishes, we will be ready to give the manufacturer the green light.

Production Time: Our previous games shipped 8 months after their campaigns. We are confident Crypt will deliver in that time frame or sooner. Those that pledge to receive Road to Infamy will be happy to know that the games are already in our possession and will begin shipping the day the campaign ends.

updates.update_userinfo: Crypt Reprint Survey / New Kickstarter Launch
updates.update_content:
Crypt Reprint Survey
As of this week, we're down to last couple hundred copies of our stock of Crypt, which has now sold over 30,000 copies worldwide! Since the Crypt campaign was such a big success, we're discussing the possibility of doing a 2nd Edition reprint campaign. We don't have a timeline yet, but with stock running low it could very well be soon.

updates.update_userinfo: Our new game "Afternova" is live on Kickstarter
updates.update_content:
Afternova is LIVE on Kickstarter  
We hope you've been enjoying Crypt these past months. We're so thankful that you helped make the Crypt campaign such a huge success and your support has allowed us to fulfill our dream of becoming full-time game designers. We've since devoted our time to our newest small box game experience, Afternova, which is now live on Kickstarter.

Don't Forget to Rate Crypt on BGG!
We hope everyone had a great holiday filled with game nights! If you've already had a chance to play Crypt, we would love to hear how your game session went. Be sure to rate Crypt on Board Game Geek and let everyone know your thoughts and opinions on how it plays.
All Rewards Have Been Shipped Out
Shipping is now underway for all regions! If you have questions about your order, please check the FAQ below.

Fulfillment Progress
US Backers, the games have arrived at the distribution center. They are beginning to pick and pack all the orders. ShipNaked should begin sending tracking information emails next week. 
Non-US Backers, most of you should have received your tracking information from Asia VFI and some of you have already received your games. Shipping is still in progress.

Crypt Shipping Update
US backers, your games arrived to port this morning! They were placed on the One Minato, which has docked and begun the customs process. Afterwards, they will be on their way to the distributor, packaged, and then sent off to your lovely abodes. We expect that the shipping, tracking, and confirmation email will be sent out from Ship Naked in mid-December.

Crypt is at sea!
Crypt has left port and is now floating somewhere in the ocean. We don't know exactly how far along the ship is, but we made this handy map to give you an idea of the ship's progress.

BackerKit Surveys Due October 1
Last call for surveys! You have one week to complete your shipping information. On October 1st you can no longer make changes to your shipping address and items ordered.
There are still 286 people that either haven't responded or have partially complete surveys. Please double check your BackerKit survey that your address and credit card are up to date or else we won't be able to send you your game.

What's in the box? 
Look what we just got in the mail today! Who was kind enough to send us 80 sets of Scythe metal coins? (...and how did they know we bought Scythe: Rise of Fenris yesterday??)

updates.update_userinfo: Update Your Shipping Survey by Oct 1
updates.update_content:
Double check your shipping and payment information
On October 1 the shipping surveys will be locked. You have one month left to revise your shipping and payment information on the pledge manager, BackerKit. If your survey is incomplete, your order will be delayed or canceled.

campaign.story:
When we started Restoration Games, we asked you to tell us which games to bring back. The number one request, by far, was Fireball Island. After more than a year of hard work, we are thrilled to announce: Fireball Island is back!
If this is your first time checking out the campaign, good to see you! You'll be thrilled to know that our amazing backers have already unlocked tons of stretch goals (and more still to come). As you check out the page, keep in mind that your pledge will also include all of this amazing stuff.
On the other hand, if you know you want it all and you want it now, we've got you covered.
So what are you waiting for? Come on and join the fun!
Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar improves on the art, components, and game play of the original. If you loved the game as a child, you'll see we turned that "delightful chaos" up to the max. If you never played it before, you'll appreciate it as a fun, exciting game for kids, families, and gamers alike.
We found a way to make the new island bigger, taller, faster, and cooler -- all while fitting in a smaller box.
Tom Vasel and the Dice Tower crew sat down with Justin Jacobson, the president of Restoration Games for a full, live playthrough of the base game, which should give you a good idea of how the game plays.
Sometimes, you may face Vul-Kar the way you want...
... but even then you can't be sure which way it will come out.
Even as the marble careens down the mountain, the paths and trees can divert it one way or another.
A tree might even save your life.
While the fireballs are unpredictable, we made sure that players have more control over their actions and more meaningful choices.
On your turn, play one of your two action cards to move your pawn and perform a special action.
Grab a snapshot from each part of the island and get back to the helipad.
Earn points for collecting sets of treasure.
If you get knocked down, you'll lose a treasure but gain a useful souvenir.
If you draw a Cataclysm, Vul-Kar gets to take a turn.
In all, the game remains fast, fun, and light, but offers meaningful choices.
We've also made arrangements with Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! to do a rules video at the time of release. 
NOTE: The board in the images above is a hand-painted prototype and does not reflect final art for the island. Here is the near-final art for the island and some renders showing off the detail that will show up on the finished board.
Blades of grass and cracked stones ease your path.
A lonely crab woos visitors at Skeleton Head Beach.
There are four expansions available in this campaign, and they are fully interchangeable with the base game and each other. We've also added some amazing new components, through hitting stretch goals, with no additional charge to backers.
                                                                                                                                                                                                       The view from the poop deck.
Hope you got that snapshot, Saul.
                                                                                                                                                                                        If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easy to get involved, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun. All you have to do is:
Click on the pledge level you want to back.
Enter your email address and “Continue as guest”.
Enter your payment information.
Click the big green “Pledge” button 
To keep things simple, there are only two tiers for regular backers.
(You can order additional copies or optional buys by increasing your pledge amount. See Shipping and Fulfillment below for more details.)
For verified brick-and-mortar stores: We also have a special pledge level that is just for you. You pledge only $20 during the campaign. When we are ready to ship the games, after the campaign closes, you will use our pledge manager to finalize your order and pay the remaining balance due. If you have any question about your status, please message us, and we will confirm before pledging. All the terms and other information about this pledge level can be found in this special update.
We've blown through dozens of stretch goals, like a fireball through a rickety bridge, and unlocked tons of great additional content. Backers get the Treasure Trove expansion pack for free, and it's already full of new souvenirs, injury cards, and more.
Unlocked sleeves (optional buy, manually add $15 to your pledge).
Painted minis (optional buy, manually add $10 to your pledge).
Maker Kit (optional buy, manually add $40 to your pledge)
Not much time left to hit those stretch goals!
Given the unique design of the game, we only have one prototype and couldn't send out review copies. We wanted a fun way to let a bunch of people play the game, so we took the show on the road! J.R. Honeycutt, our Tinker-in-Chief, set off on a 30-day, 13-state road trip, including a stop in Canada! We met up with some of the most amazing game stores, cafes, conventions, and content creators to bring you a chance to play the game in person. And, of course, we got to meet our amazing fans and backers. It was truly a special happening. Below are some videos from the trip. (Note: These videos are of the hand-painted prototype board; the final version of the board will have printed art and won't be as shiny.)
One of our backers, MAJBrown22 was able to make it to the Secret Cabal Meetup at Beermongers and wrote up his impressions in this Board Game Geek forum post. 
Chris has apparently been ensorcelled by Vul-Kar.
 Check out some epic skill shots in this supercut:
PLAY

We are using key fulfillment partners within each shipping region. There are no additional customs fees, VAT, or similar charges.
There is only one shipping charge per region regardless of what reward you get -- we're subsidizing the rest.
For the US, Canada, and the EU, we are proud to partner with Quartermaster Logistics, the premier provider of Kickstarter fulfillment in the gaming industry. Your games will be safely packed by their professional team, and you’ll be emailed a tracking number when your package ships. For Australian backers, we'll be using Aetherworks, who we used on our Stop Thief! campaign and who did a great job.
If you would like to order a second copy, just increase your pledge amount by the cost of that pledge. You do not need to add anything for additional shipping. If you want more than two copies, add the shipping charge for each additional set of one or two. For example, if you wanted to get three copies of the base game sent to Canada, you would pledge a total of $220.
We are using BackerKit, a third-party service that lets us manage ordering and shipping. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll have the chance add items to your pledge at that time. Importantly, though, there will be no additional fees due after the campaign. When you pledge, it will automatically calculate and add all shipping charges. The only additional charge is if you decide to get more stuff. Both pledge levels will be available in BackerKit. You can back the campaign now at any amount and choose your pledge later, or you can back at the Feel the Burn level and upgrade to the Full Vul-Kar.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Due to the limitations of our license, we are only able to offer the game in English and in the US, Canada, EU, and Australia. Please see the FAQ for more information.
As we head into the final hours of this campaign, every point of contact and bit of buzz can help. Send the message out far and wide on social media. Use these social media avatars to show your love for the game. And, remember, sometimes the best way is a direct, personal email to that one person you just know will get a kick out of it. Every little bit helps.
Restoration Games was founded by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We knew there were a lot of great treasures hidden beneath the sands of time. When we announced our plans, the response was overwhelming. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory, bringing the fun to those with fond memories, and publishing great games for demanding gamers.
We must acknowledge the rest of the team who put in an unblelievable effort to make this a reality. Jason Taylor is our Visual Restoration Wizard, who is the reason everything we do looks so good. Lindsay Daviau is our Production Superhero, who ensures the finished products look amazing. JR Honeycutt is our Tinker-in-Chief; he helps get a game from the idea to a finished design. Suzanne Sheldon, our Master-of-Fireworks, makes sure everyone knows what we're up to.
We had lots of talented help with the art and design of the game. George Doutsiopoulos did the fantastic cover illustrations for the base game and the three main expansions. Card art is by Victor Perez Corbella. David Kegg did the retro art that appears in various places in the game, branding, and this campaign. Jean-Louis Sirois helped with some extra foliage illustration you see on this page and on the gameboard. Additional thanks to Matijos Gebreselassie and Bill Tiller for early concept illustrations. 3D sculpting for the miniatures and island features is by Chad Hoverter. Noah Adelman of Game Trayz, LLC did the initial design work on the island trays. Design Innovation, Inc. finalized the island trays. The video work was done by Josh McDowell, and the voiceover was performed by Graham Rowat. Rulebook editing was done by the Meeple Lady. Our thanks to all of them for their unbelievable effort in bringing this project to fruition.
And, of course, we would be remiss not to mention the original masterminds behind the game, Bruce Lund and Chuck Kennedy.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our second Kickstarter and fourth game overall. Our first Kickstarter, for Stop Thief! was, by all accounts, a huge success. We received many compliments on how we handled everything, making sure everyone got their games in a timely manner. We pride ourselves on our customer service. If something happens, we'll work hard to make it right.

That said, Fireball Island is a design project unlike any other, involving three-dimensional, mechanical, plastics. Rob, Jason, and Lindsay have decades of experience working at Hasbro on such products.

This is also a licensed product. However, Justin negotiated complete creative control in the licensing agreement. Therefore, no final approval is needed to move to production.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Sorry for the extended delay, folks, but we've just released the Fun Run mode in the app. You don't need to do anything special; just download the latest version of the app from your platform of choice and get playing.
The new mode introduces a real time element to the game, making it even more frantic. Once enabled, the app plays a soundtrack that randomly and periodically plays three different sounds. If a sound plays while it's your turn, you suffer the corresponding penalty. So you'll want to move as quickly as possible. Remember, finishing your turn also means resetting the marbles on the board, so a 4-fireball Cataclysm can be positively nerve-wracking. Even when you make it to the Hello-Copter, you'll still have to act quickly so you don't lose any treasures.

Just a quick update to let you all know that the app has been updated to include scoring for the Spider Springs expansion. Still working on the art assets for the Fun Run update, which should be soon.

updates.update_userinfo: Roll for Initiative! -- Artist Poster Series!
updates.update_content: Gather your party and grab your potions of fire resistance. We've recently uncovered a promotional adventure module that EmberCorp made. This was a stretch goal, but moreso, a labor of love for Rob and myself (and our friend Kit, who's a great writer). We hope you enjoy.

updates.update_userinfo: Spider Springs (and More) at Gen Con
updates.update_content:
Hard to believe, but Gen Con is just around the corner. This is always a hectic and exciting time of the year. This year's Gen Con is shaping up to be a big one.
First things first, let's talk Fireball Island. We were able to demo the new expansion, Spider Springs, at Origins, and folks are going bananas over this one. We learned a lot developing the base game and the initial slate of expansions. We figured out which things work best and what people like the most. What's fun, and what's too fiddly. We've taken all of those lessons to heart in producing Spider Springs, and I think this is going to be a must-have expansion for die-hard FI fans. It adds a healthy dose of mayhem and whimsy while still fitting in seamlessly to the regular game. You can learn more about the expansion on its . (Our website is in the middle of a makeover.)

Hello, everybody! For those of you that don't subscribe to our newsletter -- shame on you! -- we just announced a Fireball Island Maker Kit contest. We know that some of you have been doing some cool things with the game, but we want to share these creations with everyone and have some fun. 
All you have to do to enter the contest is share an image of your Maker Kit creation on social media (twitter, facebook, and instagram are all fine) and tag Restoration Games with #MyFireballIsland.

Just a quick update to let everyone know that, at the request of some backers, we've made the .stl files of the player pawns available for download on our website. Or you can get them directly using this link.
These are for non-commercial use only, but they're a good way to 3D print a replacement pawn if one goes missing or breaks (or if you are always fighting over who gets to play Saul).

updates.update_userinfo: EmberCorp Team-Building Exercise AKA Cooperative Mode
updates.update_content:
If you want a change of pace, now you can work together to take on Vul-Kar. You can download the cooperative rules here:
Fireball Island Cooperative Rules
If you have questions about the rules, you'll probably do best posting them at Board Game Geek, where they'll also live on to help others with similar questions. But, of course, I am happy to answer questions here as well.

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Talk About Some Other Kickstarters
updates.update_content:
There are a couple of new Kickstarters out there that might be of interest to Fireball Island fans.
The Secret Cabal has launched their 2019 campaign. Yes, we have a promo card in there. Yes, you can only get it as part of their full promo pack, which is $50. Obviously, we fully support them. They are great content creators and supporters of the hobby. However, if you are not inclined to support them or don't have the means, we intentionally designed the card as an injury card, so it would not impact core play. I do want to be clear though: We do not have any of these cards ourselves, so we cannot offer to sell them directly. I know some folks are just anti-promo. But we know, for a fact, that these promo cards help content creators like the Secret Cabal to meet their costs, and we believe strongly that media voices such as theirs contribute to a strong and growing hobby.

updates.update_userinfo: Golden Geek Award Nominations - Spare a Vote?
updates.update_content:
Just a quick update. We're thrilled that Fireball Island: The Curse of Vul-Kar has been nominated for a Golden Geek Award in the categories of Family Game, Thematic Game, and Artwork and Presentation. If you're inclined, we'd really appreciate your vote, especially in the Family Game category.
Golden Geek Award Voting Page

Pardon the shortness of this update. I’m out in Reno, Nevada at the GAMA trade show, telling all the retailers about our great games. It’s also a popular time to announce new products. Yesterday, we announced Unmatched, a new take on Star Wars: Epic Duels. But we’re also announcing the next Expansion for Fireball Island: Spider Springs!
This new expansion is another island tray, like Crimson Cutlass, but it actually slots into the main island in one of the gaps between the side trays. You still get to it through the caves, but now it interacts with the main island. Specifically, a broken bridge connects them, with an ember marble on it. When a fireball hits it or when you launch it directly, it drops down into the new tray. At the base of the tray, is a spring-loaded web contains small plastic spiders. When the marble hits, the catch releases, launching the spiders into the air. In short, more mayhem.

project_data.project_name: Fireball Island - 80's Board Game, Reignited and Restored

campaign.story:
Welcome to Dragon Reach...
...the bustling new frontier settlement in the Realm of Smiteros. The zone portals have just opened, and as we speak the first heroes are braving the Dungeon in search of fame, glory, and level-ups. Besieged monsters lurk on the outskirts of town looking for opportunities to gear themselves up against their new foes. For you, this means only one thing: PROFIT!
Master the Art of the Swindle
You've got limited time to make as many Vorpal Pieces (VPs) as you can before the Heroes battle the Boss and move on to the next town.
Trash the Treasures, then earn Cash from the Trash. Buy magic items and gems from the Heroes. Smash them into raw materials! Use those materials to craft powerful Artifacts to sell to the dungeon's inhabitants. 
Get 'em Coming and Going. Spend your gold buying loot from the Heroes, then get your gold back by selling them potions and other useless crap.  
Scam to your Advantage. Use Scam cards like Bait and Switch and Sleight of Hand to manipulate the market and get an edge over your opponents.
Make your Mark. Level up your Crafting Mastery and specialize in specific crafting materials for maximum prestige and profit.    
Heroes Welcome is a 60-90 minute game for 2-5 players, aged 14 and up.
Kickbacks Expansion (FREE to KS Backers! $10 Value!!)
The Heroes Welcome: Kickbacks Expansion expands on the Eager Customer marketplace. As time passes, each customer offers a special incentive to Goblins for crafting their artifacts. Some are extra payments, but some are favors which will impact the rest of play. The Kickbacks Expansion will not be included in the retail version of the game. This $10 Expansion is free to all Kickstarter backers.
 This card entitles you to make the first move in any game of Heroes Welcome that you play.  
Overview of a Turn
On your turn, you choose ONE of the following actions:
> Run a Shop: Move the Heroes to an adjacent open shop. Run a shift at that shop, which will allow you to buy and sell from the Heroes. When you're done, put a "closed" sign on the shop. It can't be used by any other player this round. 
> Visit a Guild: Pick an open Guild and use its action. Guilds are special locations that the Heroes don't visit. Each one provides a special game action, like increasing your crafting skills, or adding a new shop to the city. Like shops, each guild can only be used by one player each round.   
> Craft for a Monster:  Head over to the workshop to smash your loot into raw materials and craft an artifact for an eager customer. As soon as you're done, the monster will head back to the dungeon to fight the Heroes. This is where the real money is! 
> Call for Round End: Send the Heroes back to the dungeon to get more loot. Other players can veto this action to keep the round going, but only if they are willing to bribe you with loot...   
Marc LeBlanc teaches how to play Heroes Welcome!
 Rahdo's Heroes Welcome Gameplay Runthrough
 Here is Rahdo's Heroes Welcome Extended Gameplay Video
 Tantrum House HW Preview
Click for full review!

Keep up on Heroes Welcome: Merchants of Dragon Reach 
- Follow Heroes Welcome on Facebook and Twitter
- Heroes Welcome on BoardGameGeek.com 
- Twitter: Follow @ebaraf and @pencilfirst
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Heroes Welcome: Merchants of Dragon Reach is well tested and balanced. The graphic design is near complete and the card art is final. Box and instructions are near final and we have been working closely with our printer. We are continuing to fine tune the gameplay experience and some iconography as we go.

There are inherent risks whenever undertaking a project as complex and large as producing and distributing a board game, but Ed Baraf has now run many successful Kickstarters and delivered their games. We've gone out of our way to surround ourselves with experienced board game developers, distributors, and people who have run and launched successful Kickstarters. This team of friends has been exceedingly supportive and we're sure they will help as we hit any upcoming bumps in the road. And there are bumps. Strikes, shortages, shipping delays are all hard to predict.

Most importantly, if something does go wrong, we will keep everyone in the loop as the project moves forward and comes to market. This game will exist because you all will have made it happen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Oy, Goblins! 
You haven't heard from us in a while, and with good reason.  We respect your inbox, which is why we told you last year that we will only send an update if there is big news to share.

Oy, Goblins! 
Thank you for sticking with us since we launched the campaign last year. At this point the game has been manufactured, delivered to backers and is available at  That said, this will be our final monthly update. Going forward, we'll only send updates if there is Big News that we need to share.

Oy Goblins! 
The Heroes are here! Let's get ready to SWINDLE!

Oy, Goblins,
We hope everyone has had a great February. We're pleased to announce fulfillment will be underway this March! We expect WW shipment to begin preparation the first week of March and be in full motion before the end of the second week. Our EU fulfillment center doesn't quite have the shipment yet, but it is landed and being processed at port.

updates.update_userinfo: January Update: We're on a Boat!
updates.update_content:
Oy, Goblins!  
The games are fully assembled and have left China on boats, one headed for North America and one headed for Europe. We don't have an exact date for landfall, but we're hopeful that we can start shipping out to backers sometime in March.  We'll know more by the time the February update comes out.

updates.update_userinfo: December Update: Manufacturing Progress, Unboxing Video, and More!
updates.update_content:
Oy Goblins! 
Merry Lootsmas! We are midway through manufacturing at Whatz Games in Shanghai.  Printing is complete, and the factory just needs to assemble all the pieces into finished games for you. We are feeling confident that the final product will be on the boat by the end of January.

updates.update_userinfo: November Update: Box Insert and Pre-Orders
updates.update_content:
Oy, Goblins! 
Things are moving along. We have approved all our proofs, and are hoping to start manufacturing in early December!

Oy, Goblins! 
We finally received our proofs from the manufacturer (Whatz Games).  Take a look.
Happy Goblin Day!

updates.update_userinfo: September Update: Final prep for printing!
updates.update_content:
Ahoy Goblins!
Fall is upon us and our craftsfolk are making the final fixes to our eProofs. We should receive one last version from Whatz and then we'll move to our Print Proof and White box / components samples. This all lives in the "Manufacturing phase." If all is in order, we should begin formal printing late October and wrap up as we head into December.

campaign.story:
On the corner of Main St. and First Blvd. in Popperville, a small mom and pop store opens its doors. The subtle rhythm of the music wafts its way out the ajar door. You poke your head in, not sure what to expect; all the same, you are surprised by what you see. The hushed murmurs of passion and energy procreating from the filled room send tingles throughout your body. You involuntarily step inside the doorway, smiling, as you survey the scene of people weaving in and out of each other’s way. They stream from the magazine rack containing some of the most popular publications about vinyl records, back to the aisles of albums looking for the perfect album to complete their perfect collections. You are enamored with the intensity of the scene and feel the need to start your own perfect collection.
Vinyl is designed by Eric Alvarado and can play from 2 to 4 players. Players will use a combination of set collection, card drafting, worker placement and hand management to build the best collection of Vinyl records and win the game.
Introducing the Top Shelf Expansion that will be exclusive to Kickstarter and will not be released in the Standard Version of the game at retail.
After the game has been set up, each player will have a hand of five to seven Magazine Rack cards, depending on where they are seated in accordance with the start player. Each player will also have two Loyalty Cards for end game goals.
On their turn, the active player will place their meeple at a location in the Record Store.
There are 5 locations in the store in a 4 player game. Each location has a different action that can be completed by the active player. The lower action is the Primary Action and the upper action is the Bump Action. After the active player places their meeple on the store location’s Primary Action, they then will perform that action.
The Bump Action happens when the active player moves their meeple to the same location that a non-active player’s meeple is located. The non-active player slides their meeple to the Bump Action Location. After the active player is done with their Primary Action, the non-active player can now take their bump action.
Collecting Albums
Players will use Magazine Cards to collect albums from the Bins. They must match all the attributes on the Album Card. The magazine cards are discarded and the Album is added to their active collection.
 Pure: Players must match the Genre and one other Attribute
 Mixed 1: Players must alternate Genre and match one other Attribute
Mixed 2: Players must alternate Genre and match two other Attributes
Refilling the Record Bin
When an album is collected out of a Record Bin or Sale Bin the albums move downward and fill in the empty spots.
 Building Collections in your Player Area
When a player adds an album to their collection, they will score the album on the score track.
Retiring an Active Collection
At any point during a player's turn, they may retire an active collection. When you retire a collection you can take a Collection Reward Token
During gameplay, a player can visit the Front Counter and as their Primary Action may draw two new Loyalty Cards. You may keep any two and discard two. You may also perform this as a Bump Action at the Magazine Rack. Loyalty Cards are kept secret until the end of the game. At that time, they will be revealed and scored.
Game End
The game will end when the album Stockpile is empty and all the albums have emptied out from the store. Each player will get one final turn. Players will now add in the Loyalty Cards and Collection Rewards to their final score to determine the winner.
  Click to read the full review
                                          Click to listen in on the podcast.
Click to listen in on the podcast.
                                                                      Click to read the full write up.
 Full Play Through
Talon Strikes has offered a custom box for each of its previous Kickstarter games. The feedback has been awesome. This is why we continue to offer a high-end version to backers that want it. The Platinum Edition will have plenty of added value over the Gold Edition.
Examples of Past Boxes from other games
House of Borgia
King's Champion
 The 80s expansion will add in some new mechanics to the game. We have opened up the Trade Counter. You will now be able to trade unwanted or low-value records in to gain attributes that you may use in later turns.  
Collection rewards have been reduced to max out 4. The lower end will now be 2 albums in a small collection and this will increase the number of records that a player may retire during the game. In addition, the Extended Play format and the Long Play format have been added as attributes and these albums can provide a bonus to your collections for end game scoring. There is still more, however.  
We have also added 12 new Loyalty Cards which will help to bolster your end game scoring even further. Taking all of this into account that is over 150 new components added to the game!  
We will also introduce gameplay with 5 Genres in play instead of 4. This will give players a different style of game in this expansion. There are 6 Genres added so that players can choose which 5 Genres they would like to play with.  
What comes in the Expansion?
 As a reminder, here's how you include Add-Ons into your pledge:  
1. Click on the “Manage your pledge” green button at the top of the page.
2. On the next screen, click on the blue “Change your pledge” button.  
3. Then, in the current reward box you’ve chosen, increase the pledge amount by the value of the add-on and then click on the green “Continue” button.  
4. A new window will appear, click on the blue “Confirm” button.  
5. It’s done! The team would like to thank you for your continued support of Vinyl. Please share the project on Facebook and Twitter.
While Stretch Goals will add many wonderful things to the game, Loyalty Rewards are a way we can give back to you, our backers. Tasks that most backers do anyways that want to help the campaign move forward. As the tasks are completed the Cards will be punched and updated. Once the cards have been completely punched we will add the reward to the game!
Add Thumbs to Board Game Geek Click Here
Follow Talon Strikes On Twitter
               Second Copy
If you wish to back two games instead of just one, please add the cost of a second game to your pledge. There is a break in the shipping for multiple copies. Please refer to the shipping chart above and add the correct amount of shipping to you pledge. 
There is no way around shipping. However, Talon Strikes Studios will share the burden of shipping with you. We will subsidize the shipping to lessen the cost. This helps to make shipping affordable for everyone. We will be fulfilling Vinyl at depots around the world. While we cannot guarantee that you will not have an import tax, but by bringing the game into your zone in bulk we absorb this burden as well.
Fulfilling a game is not something to be taken lightly. We here, at Talon Strikes Studios, work very hard to do the very best we can for you. We honor our backers by shipping to them first, because without you, we would not be able to manufacture and ship games.
There are a lot of different people and companies involved in bringing a game to the fulfillment stage. Once the games are on the boat we are counting on these different folks to do their portion of the fulfillment process. There are things that can pop up that are not in our control. However, just as we have done with our previous campaigns we will keep you informed through out the process and promise to bring Vinyl to your door! 
Day One Avatar
 Thank you to all the folks that have play tested Vinyl and helped bring this project to life. It has be a wonderful experience. I am very excited to present Vinyl to the board game community.

campaign.story:
Recipe Race has been added to every copy of the game! Recipe Race is a quick and addictive dexterity/speed game that puts your recipe building, ingredient stacking, flying hands to the test. Gather the right ingredients and stack them according to your recipe! Once you've finished, grab the timer token before the other players to win the round.
Extra Components: Ingredient tray, 30 Recipe Cards, 20 Challenge Cards, Magnetic Flip Box, Rulebook.
Recipe Race uses components from Sweet Mess along with additional components added just for this bonus game. All of the components needed for Recipe Race, including the game's rulebook, will be inside their own Recipe Race magnetic flip box! This box will fit right inside Sweet Mess' game box... so you can take it with you to game night, a party, or a family gathering!
Read more about Game Trayz and Sweet Mess here!
On your turn you will select an available Pick Action. This action will have you pick ingredients out of a bowl in a particular way. Each Pick Action you take will be unavailable on future turns until all 4 Pick Actions have been used. Once they have all been used, the markers are cleared and all actions are available again!
When you take ingredients from an Ingredient Bowl with certain pick actions, you will Make a Mess. Spreading from the bowl you picked ingredients from, add an ingredient of that bowl's type to each orthogonally adjacent bowl. Then flip the bowl over to reveal a new bowl type!
Once you pick ingredients from a bowl, you will place them to an open section of your Pastry Bench. You must place all the ingredients into one section. You cannot add to an already occupied section and you cannot split the ingredients into multiple sections!
When you store ingredients to a section of your pastry bench, you activate the associated Bench Tool of that section. At the end of your turn, flip the tile to its activated side to show it is available. You may use one of any of the activated tools anytime during your next turn. Place a marker on it and resolve its action. You choose each turn where to place your ingredients based on what tool you want to use!
Bake desserts by following the Recipe Cards. Turn in the required ingredients and, if required, put the card in your oven according to its needed baking time. Only 1 dessert can occupy a given oven space, so plan accordingly. Desserts will bake, moving down 1 space at the start of each turn!
When you bake desserts, you can complete up to 3 Baking Bonuses to earn Baking Bonus Points. These points can be spent on accessing additional Kitchen Tools. Baking Bonus Points are also worth Cooking Points at the end of the game!
You may use Open Tools anytime during your turn by paying the associated Baking Bonus Points (coin tokens). These tools will allow to do additional actions to help  Throughout the game, players may pay to use each tool twice!
You can unlock Ingredient Masteries by scoring Recipe Cards with matching ingredient icons. When you have a matching pair, flip the Ingredient Mastery tile of that type. You now are a master in that ingredient and can use it more efficiently and sparingly. You will pay 1 less of that ingredient for the rest of the game and gain 1 Cooking Point!
                                                       Ok, baker backers. Let's see what you're made of. Two more holiday Recipe Cards added to their respective expansions if you can hit these marks. Follow these links below for each:
300 Sweet Mess BGG Fans & Subscribers! HERE
35 Facebook post shares! THIS POST
25 Tweets that include #SweetMess & #FinalHours and this link below!
Copy and paste it into your tweet.https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/bigkidgames/sweet-mess?ref=twfinal
                                                                   This exclusive deck of Recipe and Event cards are cooool! The Ice Cream Pack is all about our favorite frozen treats, but...you don't bake ice cream. Right?
Your dessert creations and your efforts in the kitchen are now being judged! The Judges Table Expansion brings new scoring elements to the game with open and secret goals.
Play with the three open goals decks to give all players a chance to score additional endgame points by completing objectives in three categories; Set Goals, Mastery Goals, and Baking Bonus Goals. The judges will award points based on how well players do in these categories!
Play with the secret goals deck(s) to give each player chances to individually score endgame points by completing personal objectives. The judges will challenge you in certain areas of the competition and award points for success!
Play with one or both of these goals systems! There will also be alternative variant play with this expansion for greater replay value.
It's that wonderful time of year when the tastiest desserts are being baked! The Christmas Gifts & Goodies Expansion adds themed Recipe and Event Cards to the game of Sweet Mess, as well as new gameplay rules.
These special desserts require the Super-ingredient (wild), but give a special bonus when baked. Introducing the Mastery Die, this expansion gives you another way to score Cooking Points. After a Christmas dessert is baked, roll the Mastery die and collect a Mastery Token that matches the result. You will score 1 point for every collected Mastery Token that matches a mastery icon on a scored Recipe Cards!
This fun twist on Ingredient Masteries adds more life to the game and is an optional module that can be included or excluded from play.
Trick or treat? Why not both?! With themed Recipe and Event cards, as well as new gameplay rules, the Halloween Trick or Treats Expansion will surely sweeten your plays of Sweet Mess!
These spooktacular desserts, when baked, will provide you with a Trick or Treat Token. These tokens can be saved and if you get a set, you will be treated with endgame points. Or you can trick another chef out of an ingredient of your choosing, but you have to give them the Trick or Trick Token in return. They of course can work toward sets or, in turn, use it on another chef! 
Choose to play with this optional module, but be careful. Some chefs just may be out to get you. Muahahahahaaa!
Add thematic flare to your plays of Sweet Mess with this quality neoprene mat. This mat features placeholders for the Ingredient Bowls, Recipe Cards, Timer Tokens, and includes a printed Event Track. What better way to show the sweet mess of this baking competition?!
These premium metal coins replace the cardboard Baking Bonus Point Tokens in the game. They now include a concaved design with a color enamel finish on the numbered side. Using these coins will add a finer visual and tactile experience to the game.

                                                                           Shipping is expensive and is burdensome for everyone. Fortunately, via our various hubs, we are able to subsidize these costs for you, making them as affordable as possible. These various hubs also allow for customs-friendly shipping that eliminate duty and tax.
If you order extra add-ons that are NOT part of your pledge level, there is an extra shipping charge in addition to your pledge level shipping. All shipping prices are in USD.
Expected to ship by Christmas 2018!
Prototype Game Components & GameTrayz
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We at Big Kid Games strive to make your Kickstarter experience a great and disappointment free experience. You are helping to bring one of our games to life and the best way for us to show you our gratitude is to deliver a quality product in a timely manner. And we aim to do just that.

Tabletop gaming is one of my biggest hobbies and a favorite activity among my family and friends. When I back a game on Kickstarter, it is my expectation to receive a product that was cared for and well made. I've been burned by a few Kickstarter campaigns and have received less than high-quality products from others. It's a big downer to have anticipated and waited that long for something only to receive something that is less than what was promised. We don't want to be at the delivering end of this type of experience.

While no one can predict unexpected obstacles that are encountered throughout a process such as this, it is our pledge to you to be upfront, honest, and professional as we work through any unfortunate challenges that may arise. Suffice it to say, any type of mishap is not expected, but we do not want to pretend that all campaigns and journeys of this nature are infallible and problem free.

Our most recently funded game, Montana: Heritage Edition, is shipping very soon! Stay tuned for more updates...

Thank you for jumping on board for what Big Kid Games has to offer. 
Enjoy our games!

Game together. 
Jason Moughon 
founder | Big Kid Games
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings, Dear Backers!
We hope all of our sweet bakers are doing well! Once again we have some exciting news to share with you, so let’s get to the point, shall we? :)

Upgraded Chips

Greetings, Dear Backers!
As promised we have some exciting news to share in this update. So let’s jump right in!

Collaborators on board!

Greetings, dear backers!
Your patience and good vibes have already started to pay off. We have some fun news to share with you today!

Collaborators

Greetings dear backers!
We are happy to announce that the plan we proposed for Sweet Mess was accepted with 763 positive votes (97,3%) out of 785. As we already mentioned this was very important for us in order to move forward, from an ethical point of view. Since you never agreed with some things that already happened until now, at least this time we wanted you to have an option of refusal and not take for granted that our plan will be accepted. So.. well done to all of you and thank you. We have our first tiny victory there. :)

Dear backers, 

Firstly I would like to thank once again all of you that shared your good vibes with us. It's greatly appreciated! 

Unfortunately some people tried to sabotage the poll with multiple votes. In just 30 minutes the positive votes from 98% went down to 70%. We were afraid that this would happen but we wanted to give it a try. We come back with a new poll where you can only vote once but unfortunately it will ask you for a Gmail account. We tried to avoid it but it seems unavoidable. Sorry about that. Here is the new link:

Greetings dear backers! :)

We would like to thank you for your patience and your positive vibes until now in the comment section. Although the reason we asked for more time is quite reasonable, it’s still understandable that each one of you has limited patience at the moment. We totally understand and we want to assure you that we did as fast as we could, given the complexity of the current situation. We need to make clear that Big Kid Games had a great collaboration so far with us, and Jason always makes it clear that he is going to support what we feel is best for the game’s future and what is best for you. This update is going to be long and quite descriptive, so

Greetings dear backers!

This is Yorgo from Fantasia Games and yes, we are the secret collaborator interested to bring Sweet Mess to life. In any other situation we would try to blend this news with a small taste of enthusiasm, but knowing how serious this situation is, allow us to treat it very seriously and methodically. Waiting for a game for so long is not fun and we sympathise with the negative emotions of each one of you. For those of you that don’t know who we are, Fantasia Games is behind the game Endless Winter - Paleoamericans that launched on KS last October. Some of you might already know how seriously we take our communication and transparency with our backers, and this is the reason we asked from Jason to take care of this update personally. We aim to do just the same... to share with you all the info we know in full transparency.

Hey, gang!
We wanted the next update to be the update where Sweet Mess' new partner (co-publishers of the game/property) were introduced and to share about the plans of its delivery to you this year, but it seems just a bit more time is needed. We have been awaiting updated information from LongPack (info that the co-pub needs for us to finalize things) and we almost have it. Although we were sure we would have it by now, they have shared with us that we will be receiving the info on Monday (email below).

TL;DR - Complexcity sold, deal wrapped. Onimaru sample in the works and coming soon, Onimaru update this weekend. Positive Sweet Mess details coming next month, including new partners and products, and its future.  2021: The year of Sweet Mess.

updates.update_userinfo: Merry Christmas, Happy New Year, and More!
updates.update_content:
I hope all of you who celebrate/observe Christmas had a great one! And happy New Year to all of you! It's been a bit since the last the update, I know... and it seems more and more people are losing confidence in me, BKG, and this game, and I understand that - It hasn't been a pleasant ride for anyone.
***Please forgive me if there are any typos or nonsense in this update. I, for once, will not proof it before sending it. It's 11:30 and it's been a weekend! I drummed for about 6-7 hours today, then I finished altering/"upgrading" my two youngest boys' bunk bed tonight (about 3 hours of wood work), then had a 2-hour long board meeting with the sports organization where I hold a coaching position.

campaign.story:
It’s another beautiful day in the village! Your farmer is hard-working and defenseless, your wall is strong and true, your raider is a plucky underdog, and your merchant is hiring the finest folk that turnips can buy.
Everything is perfect...except for those HORRIBLE OTHER VILLAGES! Ugh, you hate them so much!
But you’ve got a plan to rise above these petty squabbles. You’re going to become a KINGDOM. 
In Village Pillage, you're racing your neighbors to acquire 3 relics and prove your right to rule. Each turn, everybody simultaneously plays cards against both their neighbors. It's rock-paper-scissors meets the prisoner's dilemma...with turnips!
If you think your opponents are planning to farm, raid them! If they're planning an attack, man the walls! And if they're putting up defenses: it's farming time.
Buy more powerful cards to improve your hand, and start building up your turnip collection! Once you have enough, you need to send your vulnerable merchant to buy a relic. And your neighbors know that. But you know they know that. But they KNOW you know they know that...
Check it out!
 Village Pillage rules!
Cards steal and gain turnips, defend your stockpile, buy new cards, and convert your turnips to relics. The first player to acquire 3 relics wins the game!
With 20 unique market cards you can buy for your village and add to your hand, every game is different!
               All shipping is the same low price, no matter how many copies of Village Pillage in your order!
All backers of this campaign will get a free copy of the expansion: 4 new base cards and 3 new relics, so you can play Village Pillage with up to 6 players (or play two simultaneous 3-player games!)
Your support is the only way we can make Village Pillage a reality! By supporting us on Kickstarter, you can help us create this fun family game...and by backing, you’ll get the game before anyone else!
The retail version of Village Pillage is 2-5 players only. Back now to get the expansion pack for free, and include an additional player in your games!
      Visit Jellybean-Games.com to learn about our other projects!  
Special thanks to: 
Jessa R Morgen, our customer service representative,
Dave Scott, our social media manager, 
Daniel and David Stephenson, for development assistance,
Vaughn Reynolds for Kickstarter assistance.
If you like Village Pillage, please support the project (every dollar helps!) and tell your friends, especially if they have kids, know kids, or love great games!
Or, if they have a severe turnip-deficiency. This game will clear that up real quick.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our seventh project, and we are getting better every time! We have already completed the majority of our development: we’ve gone through months of blind playtesting, and the rulebook, art, graphic design, and all cards are complete.

Once the campaign wraps up, all we need to do is send it to the printer.

That’s it!

We are renowned for keeping our backers in the loop through our comprehensive updates. When you back a Jellybean Games campaign, you know you’re in good hands!

If you have any questions, you can message us through Kickstarter or email our awesome customer service guru jessa@jellybean-games.com for a prompt response.

We are so confident that you're going to love this game, we're offering a money-back guarantee: At any time before we ship, you can get in contact for a full refund. As well as that, if you decide that Village Pillage isn’t for you within a month of receiving it, you can return it and get your money back, no questions asked.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey!
The new campaign is entering its final 24 hours, which means this is your last chance to get in on the exciting turnip action! Since our last update, we’ve unlocked 10 additional wooden turnips, the 4th (and final) promo card and…
The 6th Player Expansion!

updates.update_userinfo: We've unlocked 3 promo cards, and The Ultimate Pillager is halfway through!
updates.update_content:
Hey!
The new campaign is smashing through several stretch goals each week. We've now unlocked three promo cards, custom-cut turnips, an upgraded box, and we have a lot more on the horizon!

Hey!
If you haven't checked out the new campaign yet, we've been smashing through stretch goals! 
And - of course - our backers have been fiercely battling it out in...
The Ultimate Pillager

Hey!
Over on the new campaign, I'm excited to announce that we've unlocked some stretch goals (including the first promo card!) and launched...
The Ultimate Pillager

Hey!
I'm excited to announce: the new Village Pillage campaign is LIVE!

Hey!
Since the last update, I’ve had a few messages asking me various versions of the same thing:
“Hey, Peter...what really happened with Village Pillage?”
I hate to be the bringer of boring news, but...there’s no secret. It’s exactly what we said! We felt like a few elements of the campaign could be improved upon, so we decided to relaunch. The plan is to fund faster, build a little more momentum, and unlock more stretch goals!

Hey!
Shortly after this update goes out, we’re going to be canceling the Village Pillage Kickstarter.
Never fear! The game isn’t going anywhere - we’re going to be relaunching very soon, bigger and better than before! You’re here because you want a copy of this great game, and we are committed to making that happen.

Farmers are green,
The Beserker is mad(ish),
All Merchants are yellow
And Walls are #TeamRadish
Hey!
Village Pillage is a game of negotiation and betrayal, of raiding and defense, of strategic upgrading...and, of course, of turnips.

updates.update_userinfo: Well over halfway to our goal!!
updates.update_content:
Raiders are red
Walls are all blue
The florist gains five
But you steal at +2
Hey!
My name’s Peter - I’m the co-designer of Village Pillage, along with Tom Lang (who wrote the poem you see above). I’m also the founder of Jellybean Games, an avid collector of books about Jim Henson, and an Australian with a blue beard. (This is less remarkable than you may think.  Australians have blue beards.)
